item.title: Product Manager
item.description:
‍

Canvass AI – Disrupting how Industrials Improve Global Productivity and Sustainability

Do you want to make a positive impact on the world?

Canvass AI is disrupting the manufacturing and industrial sector by making the hype of AI a reality. Our AI platform is fast becoming the most in-demand solution on the market because we put the power of AI in the hands of industrial engineers, who can now unleash the value in their data in ways they’ve never been able to before! We are helping the world’s largest companies drive impactful results, almost instantly, from improving their productivity to spearheading their global sustainability efforts. Our software and customer deployments prove each day that AI is revolutionizing how manufacturers reduce carbon emissions, waste, water, and energy consumption.

Proudly funded by Alphabet’s Gradient Ventures and Yamaha Motor Ventures. Join us on the quest to build a more sustainable and productive future!

DO WHAT YOU LOVE!

Reporting to the Director of Product Management, the Product Manager’s role is to define where our Industrial AI platform needs to go by creating a roadmap about what needs to get built and communicating those needs to our engineering team.  The Product Manager will be responsible for full life cycle product management and overall positioning of the platform for commercial success including supporting the sales team and marketing team with their efforts.

‍

MAKE AN IMPACT!
  1. Support Canvass AI’s overall growth strategy in terms of securing more customers and greater revenue by creating and defining the future direction for our Industrial AI platform including plans, tangible visions, and roadmaps to get there. Additional responsibility includes ensuring full adoption and usage of the Canvass platform, post purchase.
  2. Lead the development of future releases of the platform by working with product designers and software engineers. Specifically, the product manager will be responsible for defining the specifications of new capabilities to be built, ensuring those specifications are communicated to and understood by product designers and software engineers, and guiding the software development process.
  3. Become and be recognized as an internal expert on the Canvass AI platform.  Demonstrate leadership by providing training and information on specific products such as: “how to talk about the product”, “how to position the product” and be able to demo the product and share information about its application and use in industry in easy-to-understand terms.

‍HAVE WHAT IT TAKES?

  • 3 – 5 years work experience in an industrial engineering setting, with a preference for process industries (vs discrete)
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering or a technology related field
  • Deep knowledge of Operational Technology (Plant floor systems and technology)
  • Experience working with industrial data (e.g., Data Historians such as OSIsoft PI System, AspenTech IP.21)
  • OEE (Overall Equipment Effectiveness) understanding and demonstrated use.
  • Ability to identify customer/user problems and define software solutions to address them
  • Excellent communication skills, able to work equally well with our customers, developers and internal stakeholders such as Marketing and Customer Success
  • A curious nature to think outside the box and a love to experiment.    
  • Collaboration skills and the knowledge that success as a product manager is rooted in ensuring the whole team is aligned and working together toward the same goal
  • [Nice to have] B2B SaaS Company experience
  • [Nice to have] Agile software environment
  • [Nice to have] Strong data literacy and a track record of using data and experimentation to drive product decision
  • [Bonus] Having built AI and machine learning models to solve industrial problems
  • [Bonus] Preferably you’ve worked in a startup before and understand life in a startup
  • [Bonus] Experience using Pendo

‍

WHY YOU WANT TO BE PART OF OUR TEAM!

Canvass AI is a leader in industrial AI. Canvass is innovating the way and empowering the industrial workforce to use AI in day to day operations. Our work has been recognized by Network World as a Top 10 Hot AI-Powered IoT Start-up and by Canadian Innovation Exchange as a Top 20 Most Innovative Canadian Company. We’re an agile scale-up with the operational intelligence of a global business. As we accelerate rapidly, we are constantly looking for driven and ambitious innovators to join our team.

​Canvass is a place where being formidable, innovative, and impactful is part of our DNA.  We have an inclusive culture that thrives on the challenges and opportunities that being a disruptor brings. From the CEO to the newest hire, we all pitch in where needed and do what it takes and accountability for it.  We are a flat organization where you will be invited (and expected!) to be part of the conversation!

Don’t take our word for it – see why our team love to work at Canvass.

https://www.canvass.io/careers

‍

WHAT YOU GET…  YES, THERE’S MORE!
  • Part of Canvass’s Success Story Stock options to make you an owner in the company
  • Learning and Development: Free Coursera account to advance your skills and interests
  • Fostering innovation: Hackathons to showcase your ideas and skills
  • Inspiring positive impact: Guest speakers to inspire our mission and the impact it has on the world around us
  • Rewarding high performance: Quarterly and annual All Stars recognition program
  • Social and supportive team environment: Active social committee to help you meet team members; employee off-site events
  • Focus on health and wellness: Generous vacation and health benefits, annual wellness gift we cover 100 percent of the premiums
  • Technology: Whether you’re working from the office or remotely, you’ll have access to the right tech and tools to set you up for success

‍

READY TO WORK?

Interested applicants are encouraged to submit a formal application through our website Careers (canvass.io).

We love connecting with candidates who want to know more - find our staff on LinkedIn and get connected today!

https://www.linkedin.com/company/canvassai

Canvass AI supports an inclusive safe working environment and welcomes and encourages applications from all people. Accommodations are available by request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.  Please include your request for any specific accommodations in your covering letter.

item.title: Senior Data Scientist
item.description:
Canvass AI – Disrupting how Industrials Improve Global Productivity and Sustainability

Do you want to make a positive impact on the world?

Canvass AI is disrupting the manufacturing and industrial sector by making the hype of AI a reality. Our AI platform is fast becoming the most in-demand solution on the market because we put the power of AI in the hands of industrial engineers, who can now unleash the value in their data in ways they’ve never been able to before! We are helping the world’s largest companies drive impactful results, almost instantly, from improving their productivity to spearheading their global sustainability efforts. Our software and customer deployments prove each day that AI is revolutionizing how manufacturers reduce carbon emissions, waste, water, and energy consumption.

Proudly funded by Alphabet’s Gradient Ventures and Yamaha Motor Ventures. Join us on the quest to build a more sustainable and productive future!

DO WHAT YOU LOVE!

Reporting to the VP Customer Success, the Senior Data Scientist works directly with Customers to rapidly enable them to gain value through the use of the Canvass Platform. This role also requires extensive collaboration across all Canvass Departments to promote and evolve the Canvass Platform.

MAKE AN IMPACT!

  • Help Customers solve industrial problems (such as predictive maintenance of critical assets, optimizing controllable set points to enhance product qualities, reducing the used energy in production, reducing the product waste, maximizing the yield in a production line, etc.) using the Canvass Platform. This work will include:
  1. Assisting customers in designing solution architectures to appropriately prepare data, build AI models and evaluate results
  2. Providing advice and guidance to the junior Canvass team members regarding how to efficiently interact with customers to solve industrial problems using the Canvass platform
  • Rapidly find and learn new tools and technologies presented in research communities to implement and adapt within the Canvass platform for solving industrial problems
  • Perform research activities to create advanced data-driven functionalities for solving industrial problems.
  • Collaborate with Product and Engineering to drive the evolution of the Canvass Platform
  • Enhance the Canvass Brand through the use of Social Media, writing White Papers, and speaking at Conferences
  • Support Sales by actively participating in sales meetings and identifying appropriate customer uses of the Canvass Platform

HAVE WHAT IT TAKES?

  • Deep understanding of concepts in statistics and machine learning; ideally including knowledge and experience with reinforcement learning
  • Experience working with industrial time series data
  • Ability to communicate data science results to our non-technical customers
  • Ability to translate business problems into data science solutions
  • Willingness to participate in both sales and delivery of meaningful business solutions using data science
  • Research or practical experience in building machine learning models
  • Experience using tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy
  • Proven ability to build solutions based on research papers or other publications
  • Prior experience leading and mentoring less experienced data scientists
  • Willingness and ability to occasionally travel (domestic and international) to customers, prospects and conferences
  • Hold (ideally advanced) degree in Artificial Intelligence or Machine Learning

WHY YOU WANT TO BE PART OF OUR TEAM!

Canvass AI is a leader in industrial AI. Canvass is innovating the way and empowering the industrial workforce to use AI in day to day operations. We are a flat organization where you will be invited (and expected!) to be part of the conversation!

Don’t take our word for it – see why our team love to work at Canvass.

WHAT YOU GET... YES, THERE’S MORE!

  • Fostering innovation: Regular Hackathons to showcase your ideas and skills
  • Inspiring positive impact: Guest speakers to inspire our mission and the impact it has on the world around us

item.title: Account Executive
item.description:
A Leader in Automating Intelligent Industrial Operations

At Canvass Analytics, we are disrupting the way industrial operational data is being used to make critical business decisions. Our disruptive, leading edge AI-powered analytics platform transforms plant operations, giving them predictive insights that enable autonomous operations.

Canvass AI software platform is empowering Fortune 1,500 industrial companies to transform industrial engineers into digital engineers who are driving data driven decisions in day to day operations. Canvass Analytics’ customers include leading energy, manufacturing, food and ag, oil and gas, and metals and mining companies around the globe.

We’re an agile scale-up with the operational intelligence of a global business. As we accelerate rapidly, we are constantly looking for driven and ambitious innovators to join our team.

Who We Need

Canvass Analytics is seeking an Account Executive to join our sales team, a true hunter who wants to join us in North America at this pivotal point in our growth. You will develop your territory, build out the sales strategy and satisfy your drive to close the deal. You are a pioneer in an industry calling out for disruption, transforming the way operational decisions in the Industrial sector are made using AI.

Who You Are

You are ready to take the next step in your career, understand the Industrial market and come with a roster of contacts who you are prepared to call. You have a proven track record of building relationships, from C-suite to Operations Managers. Empowering prospects and clients with data-driven insights to help them save money, accelerate competitive advantage and stay ahead is what motivates you. You are happiest on the road pursuing your targets and gaining new ground in this race to become an industry leader in industrial AI.

What You Bring
  • You have an Engineering degree and the logical, technical approach that comes with it.
  • Industry experience. You have 5 years selling into industrial companies, perhaps working for larger companies and moving into progressively more nimble ones. You get an adrenaline rush every time you close the deal. Your achievements go beyond quotas, extending into highly satisfied clients who trust your expertise.
  • Motivation and drive. You get a thrill from pursuing the close which also means you are calm under pressure and can make sound decisions quickly. The confidence in our product and our company just makes it easier for you.
  • Sales methodology and innovation. You believe in following a process because it works and changing it up when it doesn’t. You want to contribute to building tactics and refining our processes for repeatable success.
  • Communication. You have outstanding presentation skills. Your consulting approach in meetings gains the trust of those listening to you. Your written and verbal one-on-one communication skills - including the ability to listen and provide a real solution to a client’s unique issues - are why you consistently exceed quota.
  • Passion. You want to be in sales - this is where your career path starts and ends. You are genuinely interested in new ideas and new technology.
Your Benefits

Some of the benefits you can expect as part of our team include:

  • Awesome team and culture (every day)
  • Generous time off, including vacation and personal days to help rejuvenate
  • Extended health benefits, including drug coverage, dental coverage, and a Health Spending Account
  • Flexible office policy, with options to work remotely
  • Attend Conferences to extend your knowledge and skills
  • Company-provided MacBooks and standing desks
  • Top technology and tools to excel at your role
  • Free team lunches
Why Join Canvass?

Canvass Analytics is using AI to automate operations for theIndustrial sector. We are changing the way industry thinks and uses AI, and it’s getting noticed everywhere.  We’ve been recognized by Network World as a Top 10 Hot AI-Powered IoT Startups and by Canadian Innovation Exchange asa Top 20 Most Innovative Canadian Company. Canvass is backed by Google’sGradient Ventures.

What\'s it like working at Canvass?

This is a place where everyone is all in.  From the CEO to the newest hire, we all pitch in where needed and do what it takes.  We are a relatively flat organization where everyone is invited to the table, to listen in and be part of the conversation and decisions.  We have an inclusive culture.

Apply Now

Think this job is meant for you but worried you don’t have it all?If you feel you meet 70% of the qualifications listed and you are an innovative team player, express your interest here and we promise to consider your full profile.

You can also follow us on Twitter or LinkedIn to learn more about us.

Canvass Analytics welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

item.title: Sales Development Representative
item.description:
Canvass AI – Disrupting how Industrials Improve Global Productivity and Sustainability

Do you want to make a positive impact on the world?

Canvass AI is disrupting the manufacturing and industrial sector by making the hype of AI a reality. Our AI platform is fast becoming the most in-demand solution on the market because we put the power of AI in the hands of industrial engineers, who can now unleash the value in their data in ways they’ve never been able to before! We are helping the world’s largest companies drive impactful results, almost instantly, from improving their productivity to spearheading their global sustainability efforts. Our software and customer deployments prove each day that AI is revolutionizing how manufacturers reduce carbon emissions, waste, water, and energy consumption.

Proudly funded by Alphabet’s Gradient Ventures and Yamaha Motor Ventures. Join us on the quest to build a more sustainable and productive future!

DO WHAT YOU LOVE!

Reporting to the Chief Commercial Officer, the Sales Development Representative will develop the fundamentals of Software Sales with a goal of promoting into a full closing role as an Account Executive. The SDR will be required to discover and pique the interest of C Level executives of our current and potential client base in the manufacturing industry and to communicate the link between their needs and our solutions.  Furthermore, using the sales funnel model, the SDR will work with the management team to transition clients through the various stages from awareness to post-purchase to ensure the highest level of client satisfaction.  We are looking for competitive, dynamic and self-motivated people who want to jump start their sales career by building the foundation of becoming a top sales performer.

Successful candidates must have a strong work ethic, passion for providing the right solutions and the drive to exceed sales targets.  The SDR will work closely with the Management and Senior Sales people, providing the opportunity to rapidly develop your career in sales.

MAKE AN IMPACT!
  • Perform outbound sales activities such as phone calls, emails, and demo scheduling
  • Meet or exceed key activity metrics for calls, emails, qualified opportunities, demos booked and more
  • Qualify inbound sales inquiries and appropriately advance them to the next step in the company\'s sales cycle
  • Be a product knowledge expert and successfully overcome prospective customer objections
  • Work closely with Account Executives to ensure strong communication and fill up the sales pipeline with qualified opportunities
  • Actively look for opportunities to improve and optimize outbound lead management
  • Accurately and thoroughly update records in CRM software
  • Handle a large amount of lead flow

HAVE WHAT IT TAKES?

  • Bachelor\'s degree or equivalent experience
  • Self-motivated and ambitious
  • Quick learner that is excited to take on challenging projects
  • Team player that enjoys planning, executing, winning, and celebrating as a team
  • Entrepreneurial mindset and able to tackle anything that comes your way
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • 1-2 years’ work experience in sales role preferably in an outbound calling environment

Don’t take our word for it – see why our team love to work at Canvass.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer
item.description:
Canvass AI is disrupting the industrial sector with its cutting-edge AI platform, by transforming industrial engineers into data and digital engineers. Backed by some of the world’s largest companies like Google’s Gradient Ventures, Canvass is democratizing the use of AI in day to day operations so industrial companies can build AI/ML models at scale and deploy them in production to gain business benefits in real time.

Things you should know about our tech:
  • ‍We use a microservices architecture built predominantly with Python
  • Our single-page web application is built with React and we use Django for our RESTful API layer
  • We use Kubernetes to manage our cloud deployments in Azure
  • We’ve built a data pipeline with Kafka and use Kubeflow to orchestrate our machine learning pipeline
  • We use CircleCI to continuously integrate and deploy code changes

‍What we’re looking for:

We’re looking for candidates with:

  • Experience building web applications with Python, bonus points for experience with a RESTful API framework
  • Experience using React (or other JavaScript frameworks) to build complex web applications
  • An understanding of microservice architecture and distributed system design
  • Proven track record of delivering well-designed and tested software
  • Solid understanding of relational and non-relational databases and best practices

In general, we’re looking for a senior developer that exemplify these qualities:

Activation & Engagement Our developers are critical to the progress of our application and our business. We expect our developers to maintain focus on the business impact of their changes and advocate for work that will drive outcomes instead of just output.

‍Teamwork & Collaboration Our teams are small and extremely collaborative. Developers work very closely with a small number of other developers, a designer, and a product manager to meaningfully impact the business every week.

‍Excellence & Craft Software development is more than checking features off a list of requirements. We need our developers to build systems that are accessible to new teammates and extensible so that they can evolve with our business. We want our developers to take pride in what they build.

‍Communication & Leadership A developer can have a large impact by helping to grow the abilities and understanding of their teammates. We’re looking for people who can deliver learning sessions to introduce their technical teammates to new concepts and who can explain and contextualize their work to teammates outside of engineering.

What’s in it for you

You want to join a company that’s at the forefront of leading edge technology and you want to be the person that takes us there and captures massive market share. You want to be part of an ambitious, successful team that is rapidly scaling up, that gives you room to grow and build your career as the company grows.  

Your Benefits

Some of the benefits you can expect as part of our team include:

  • An incredible team with Inclusive culture, open to ideas
  • You build the future of the planet. An opportunity to work in a leading edge AI company that is making the planet safer and greener for the future.  
  • Generous time off, including vacation and personal days to help rejuvenate
  • Extended health benefits, including drug coverage, dental coverage, and a Health Spending Account
  • Flexible office policy, with option to work remotely
  • Attend Conferences to extend your knowledge and skills
  • Equity Plan
What\'s it like working at Canvass

This is a place where everyone is all in. From the CEO to the newest hire, we all pitch in where needed and do what it takes.  We are a relatively flat organization where everyone is invited to the table, to listen in and be part of the conversation and decisions. We have an inclusive culture and we are driven by the passion to make an impact to the future of the industrial sector which in turn impacts the climate sustainability.

item.title: Sales Account Executive
item.description:
Canvass AI - Industrial AI Built for Industrial Engineers

At Canvass, we are disrupting the way industrial operational data is being used to make critical business decisions. Our disruptive, leading edge AI-powered platform, transforms plant operations, giving  predictive insights that enable autonomous operations.

Canvass AI software platform is empowering industrial companies to transform industrial engineers into digital engineers who are driving data driven decisions in day to day operations. Canvass customers include leading energy, manufacturing, and mining companies around the globe.

We’re an agile scale-up with the operational intelligence of a global business. As we accelerate rapidly, we are constantly looking for driven and ambitious innovators to join our team.

What You’ll Do

Canvass AI is seeking an Account Executive, a true hunter who wants to join our team and expand the business globally. This is an individual contributor position, newly added for business expansion.  

  • You will be identifying, negotiating and closing big deals in industrial market.  You will be comfortable presenting Canvass’s value proposition and business case to the C-Executive Suite as well as the technical users.  
  • You will be called upon to utilize superior salesmanship to develop sales opportunities and identify the necessary decision makers and champions of the prospective deal.  
  • You will listen, identify and understand customer  needs and deliver to their expectations. You will be able to build relationships with multiple stakeholders and influence them in a positive way.  
  • You will actively seek out new sales leads and business opportunities through active networking and utilizing business referrals.
  • You are hugely curious will constantly look for ways to enhance your knowledge of our industry, market, and competitors to provide that sales edge needed to close business and generate revenue.   Keep learning AND be curious: we are constantly looking for ways to enhance knowledge of our industry, market and competitors to provide the sales edge to close business and generate revenue.  
  • You will seek feedback at every opportunity so you can be the best you can be.  You will seek this from leaders, peers and clients. We do the right thing always and take extreme pride in who we are, what we build and what we do.  AND, we are led by character.
Who You Are & What Makes You Qualified

  • You are one to the top 10% of the sales people in your current company/division.  You are able to teach, tailor and take control of the sales cycle in a professional way. You are someone who pursues your passions with energy and commitment. We never, ever give up.
  • Fast learner; You are incredibly fast learner (we are in a market ready to change very fast and you have to be nimble of mind to keep up).  You have the intelligence to evolve to customer pain and map to customer personas and use cases. You will quickly learn our product, competition, processes, methodologies and how to build business cases mapped to successful business outcomes.  
  • Persistence, Heart and Desire. You will actively seek out new sales leads and business opportunities through active networking, partners and utilizing business referrals. You will be called upon to utilize superior salesmanship to develop sales opportunities and identify the necessary decision makers and influencers of the prospective deal.  get a thrill from pursuing the close which also means you are calm under pressure and can make sound decisions quickly. The confidence in our product and our company just makes it easier for you.
  • Coachability and Adaptability: You believe in following a process because it works and changing it up when it doesn’t. You want to contribute to building tactics and refining our processes for repeatable success. Being familiar with MEDDICC and Challenger Sales is a plus.
  • ‍Integrity: You will seek feedback at every opportunity so you can be the best you can be.  You will seek this from leaders, peers and clients. We do the right thing always and take extreme pride in who we are, what we build and what we do.  
  • ‍‍Curiosity: You are hugely curious will constantly look for ways to enhance your knowledge of our industry, market, and competitors to provide that sales edge needed to close business and generate revenue.  You will keep asking the customer questions and gain validation of what you heard throughout the customer journey. Keep learning. AND be curious: we are constantly looking for ways to enhance knowledge of our industry, market and competitors to provide the sales edge to close business and generate revenue.
  • You love the Digital Transformation Revolution You understand challenging the status quo will provide positive business impact to all functions of an organization is critical.
  • 5+ years success in industrial or enterprise software sales or business technology products and services.
  • Experience with and understanding of AI and Machine Learning is highly favorable.
  • Exemplary written and oral communication skills.
  • Excellent interpersonal, planning, and organizational skills.
  • "Data" experience – big data, analytics, data science, machine learning, data integration
  • Experience with selling within Industrial Manufacturing is a plus.
  • Background in selling innovation and new concepts to large Enterprises
  • Ability to travel 10 to 40%
  • Software scale up experience is a plus
  • Bachelor’s degree required

What’s in it for you

You want to join a company that’s at the forefront of leading edge technology and you want to be the person that takes us there and captures massive market share. You want to be part of an ambitious, successful team that is rapidly scaling up, that gives you room to grow and recognition as you close new accounts. With a shorter-than-usual sales cycle for enterprise, you will reap the rewards of your efforts with uncapped commission and great incentive targets.

Your Benefits

Some of the benefits you can expect as part of our team include:

  • Inclusive culture, open to ideas
  • Generous time off, including vacation and personal days to help rejuvenate
  • Extended health benefits, including drug coverage, dental coverage, and a Health Spending Account
  • Flexible office policy, with options to work remotely
  • Attend Conferences to extend your knowledge and skills
  • Company-provided MacBooks and standing desks
  • Top technology and tools to excel at your role
  • Equity Plan

‍Why Join Canvass?

Canvass Analytics is using AI to automate operations for the Industrial sector. We are changing the way industry thinks and uses AI, and it’s getting noticed everywhere.  We’ve been recognized by Network World as a Top 10 Hot AI-Powered IoT Startups and by Canadian Innovation Exchange as a Top 20 Most Innovative Canadian Company. Canvass is backed by Google’s Gradient Ventures and Yamaha Ventures.

What\'s it like working at Canvass

This is a place where everyone is all in. From the CEO to the newest hire, we all pitch in where needed and do what it takes.  We are a relatively flat organization where everyone is invited to the table, to listen in and be part of the conversation and decisions.  We have an inclusive culture.

‍

item.title: Machine Learning Engineer
item.description:
A Leader in Automating Intelligent Industrial Operations

At Canvass Analytics, we are disrupting the way industrial operational data is being used to make critical business decisions. Our disruptive, leading edge AI-powered analytics platform transforms plant operations, giving them predictive insights that enable autonomous operations.

Canvass AI software platform is empowering Fortune 1,500 industrial companies to transform industrial engineers into digital engineers who are driving data driven decisions in day to day operations. CanvassAnalytics’ customers include leading energy, manufacturing, food and ag, oil and gas, and metals and mining companies around the globe.

We’re an agile scale-up with the operational intelligence of a global business. As we accelerate rapidly, we are constantly looking for driven and ambitious innovators to join our team.

Things you should know about our product & teams
  • We don’t build machine learning pipelines to solve specific problems: we create pipelines that are able to solve classes of industrial data problems
  • We use Keras, SciKit-Learn,XGBoost, SHAP and regularly research and add new libraries to our stack
  • Our pipelines and micro services are developed predominantly with Python
  • We use Kubeflow to build flexible ML pipelines and Kafka for data pipelines
  • We use CircleCI to continuously test, integrate and deploy code changes, including ML
What we’re looking for:

We’re looking for candidates with:

  • Experience applying machine learning and deep learning algorithms to time-series problems
  • Strong knowledge of probability and statistics, plus a passion for working with data
  • The ability to implement feature engineering and data transformations at scale
  • Solid Python development skills, including experience with NumPy, Pandas and one or more ML libraries
  • An understanding of micro service architecture and containerization
  • A proven track record of delivering well-designed and tested software
​Who you are:

In general, we’re looking for engineers that exemplify these qualities:

  • Activation & Engagement Our engineers are critical to the progress of our application and our business. We expect our engineers to maintain focus on the business impact of their changes and advocate for work that will drive outcomes instead of just output.
  • Teamwork & Collaboration Our teams are small and extremely collaborative. You will work very closely with DevOps, ProductDevelopment and Customer Success to meaningfully impact the business every week.
  • Excellence & Craft Cloud infrastructure is more than just keeping the lights on 24/7. We need to build secure, scalable systems that are also easy to understand and easy to extend so that they can evolve with our business. We want our engineers to take pride in what they build.
  • Communication & Leadership An engineer can have a large impact by helping to grow the abilities and understanding of their teammates.We’re looking for people who can deliver learning sessions to introduce their technical teammates to new concepts and who can explain and contextualize their work to teammates outside of engineering.
Your Benefits

Some of the benefits you can expect as part of our team include:

  • Awesome team and culture (every day)
  • Generous time off, including vacation and personal days to help rejuvenate
  • Extended health benefits, including drug coverage, dental coverage, and a Health Spending Account
  • Flexible office policy, with options to work remotely
  • Attend Conferences to extend your knowledge and skills
  • Company-provided MacBooks and standing desks
  • Top technology and tools to excel at your role
  • Free team lunches
Why Join Canvass?

Canvass Analytics is using AI to automate operations for theIndustrial sector. We are changing the way industry thinks and uses AI, and it’s getting noticed everywhere.  We’ve been recognized by Network World as a Top 10 Hot AI-Powered IoT Startups and by Canadian Innovation Exchange asa Top 20 Most Innovative Canadian Company. Canvass is backed by Google’sGradient Ventures.

What\'s it like working at Canvass?

This is a place where everyone is all in. From the CEO to the newest hire, we all pitch in where needed and do what it takes. We are a relatively flat organization where everyone is invited to the table, to listen in and be part of the conversation and decisions. We have an inclusive culture.

Apply Now

Think this job is meant for you but worried you don’t have it all?If you feel you meet 70% of the qualifications listed and you are an innovative team player, express your interest here and we promise to consider your full profile.

You can also follow us on Twitter or LinkedIn to learn more about us.

Canvass Analytics welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

item.title: Product Marketing - Industry Lead
item.description:
A Leader in Automating Intelligent Industrial Operations

Canvass AI is disrupting the industrial sector with its cutting-edge AI platform, by transforming industrial engineers into data and digital engineers. Backed by some of the world’s largest companies like Google’s Gradient Ventures, Canvass is democratizing the use of AI in day to day operations so industrial companies can build AI/ML models at scale and deploy them in production to gain business benefits in real time.

​Job Description

Reporting to the VP of Marketing, you live and breathe product marketing and know the immense value this strategic function brings to an organization. Through your proven experience in B2B -SaaS product marketing, you have learned how to keep your eye on the big picture and execute on what needs to get done to move the needle.

We are looking for an experienced, collaborative, and driven Product Marketing Industry Lead, who will take Canvass AI to new heights and drive rapid growth across existing and new markets. You will be responsible for core go-to-market activism and ongoing product success - defining product positioning through a deep understanding of the market, buyers, and key competitors. You will synthesize information and serve as an internal and external evangelist and influencer to ensure the sales, marketing, and customer success are equipped with the right tools, knowledge, and information to properly position Canvass AI to win in the market.

Key Responsibilities

  • Conceptualize, build and analyze various marketing plans, strategies and campaigns to power the growth of Canvass AI’s brand and product.
  • Develop and launch campaigns to support our GTM (go to market) initiatives.
  • Develop targeted and meaningful content, product positioning and messaging that differentiates Canvass AI capabilities across the industry.
  • Communicate the value proposition of Canvass AI’s platform and capabilities to sales enablement and develop assets and sales tools that support the sales cycle.
  • Participate in the launch of new product releases and manage the cross-functional implementation of industry-agnostic plans.
  • Work closely with our Product Management and Go-To-Market teams to develop enablement content, product demos, sales tools and strategies.
  • Help drive market intelligence through in-depth industry and competitive analysis, while consistently devising programs to outpace the competition.
  • Develop the strategy and manage the marketing programs that drive demand within the industry.
  • Work with our broader marketing team to develop thought leadership and increase awareness of Canvass AI for expert data scientist user personas, influencers, and decision makers.
  • Create and maintain a crystal clear and highly compelling product messaging matrix.
  • Create and shape customer personas.
  • Track competitive marketing landscape against category.
  • Empower sales with competitive intelligence, and create and maintain competitor talking tracks, battle cards, cheat sheets, FAQs, and training.

Qualifications

  • SaaS product marketing experience is a must.
  • 8-10 years of work experience in B2B Product Marketing and/or Product Management.
  • Deep understanding of machine learning and analytic applications, especially in production / operational environments.
  • Demonstrated success in product launches and end-to-end execution of supporting marketing strategies.
  • Excellent communication skills a must; written and oral, including presentation and product demonstration experience to large and diverse audiences. You have a knack for developing compelling, differentiated, and memorable product narratives.
  • Analyst relations experience with firms such as Forrester and Gartner.
  • You enjoy collaborating with passionate cross-functional teams (e.g., sales, product management, marketing, customer success).
  • Roll up your sleeve get stuff done attitude with high growth start-up experience.
  • Bachelor’s degree in a related field.

Your Benefits

Some of the benefits you can expect as part of our team include:

  • Awesome team and culture (every day)
  • Generous time off, including vacation and personal days to help rejuvenate
  • Extended health benefits, including drug coverage, dental coverage, and a Health Spending Account
  • Flexible office policy, with options to work remotely
  • Attend Conferences to extend your knowledge and skills
  • Company-provided MacBooks and standing desks
  • Top technology and tools to excel at your role
  • Free team lunches

Why Join Canvass?

Canvass Analytics is using AI to automate operations for the Industrial sector. We are changing the way industry thinks and uses AI, and it’s getting noticed everywhere.  We’ve been recognized by Network World as a Top 10 Hot AI-Powered IoT Startups and by Canadian Innovation Exchange as a Top 20 Most Innovative Canadian Company. Canvass is backed by Google’s Gradient Ventures.

​What\'s it like working at Canvass?

This is a place where everyone is all in.  From the CEO to the newest hire, we all pitch in where needed and do what it takes.  We are a relatively flat organization where everyone is invited to the table, to listen in and be part of the conversation and decisions.  We have an inclusive culture

item.title: Data Scientist
item.description:
Description


Join our team and what we\'ll accomplish together

 

The Data Strategy & Enablement team is on a continuous journey towards helping TELUS become a world-class leader in data solutions, doing so by delivering data analytics capabilities built upon unified scalable platforms, advanced AI solutions, high quality data, and a data-product oriented culture while always keeping an eye on the horizon, preparing for the next big thing.


We are entrepreneurial, and live by our AI Manifesto of failing fast and being outcome vs technology driven, creating value for our customers, team members, communities, and the environment. The team takes pride in our Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning capabilities and takes ownership of each step of the process. From hypothesis generation, initial exploring of datasets, developing novel AI techniques to discover insights, to developing automation pipelines and web-visualizations, we do it all!


Always wanted to work with a team of innovators touching all business units within TELUS, and be part of a culture that embraces creativity and collaboration? If so, we’d love to talk with you!
 

You’ll be a part of the team and journey that will transform the way we do business across various domains. You’ll collaborate with teams across the company, seeking out various data sources to help identify new business opportunities while championing data driven decision making and the accelerated adoption of AI. As a Data Scientist on the team, you will combine your expert knowledge of data science with your strong software development skills to automate and facilitate data exploration, analytics, machine learning model development, training and deployment and will leverage your experience in building reusable algorithms, functions and libraries.


Here\'s how

 

  •  Lead the iterative development, validation, and deployment of AI/ML models
  • Collaborate on end-to-end automation efforts required to bring models to production
  • Work with structured and unstructured raw data to design and develop innovative predictive models, metrics, and dashboards to uncover actionable insights
  • Visualize and report data findings creatively in a variety of visual formats that provide insights to the organization
  • Influence how we approach business challenges and opportunities by driving the adoption of a data driven mindset
  • Develop re-usable code aimed at delivering on future goals faster and more reliably
  • Support and evolve the Advanced Analytics and Data Science roadmap by leveraging industry research, best practices and emerging tools/technology
  • Build and maintain a strong engagement with key stakeholders to understand business needs and priorities
     

Qualifications


What you bring

 

  •  You are recognized for addressing business needs via your application of data mining and analysis, predictive modeling, statistics and other advanced analytical techniques in which you have previous hands-on work experience
  • You are sought out for your skills in Machine Learning and AI, including regression, classification, clustering, time series analysis, NLP, and optimization and bring 2 to 5  years of hands-on work and practical business experience in the above areas
  • You are a master communicator capable of breaking down technical and complex concepts in a way that is understood by non-technical audiences
  • You have solid development experience with Python and you are comfortable using various data science libraries such as Scikit-learn, Pandas, Numpy as well as frameworks like TensorFlow, Pytorch, Keras and have applied these skills towards solving actual business matters
  • You are comfortable in and with a Jupyter environment and infrastructure, and familiar with GitHub
  • You possess advanced knowledge in SQL and distributed computing
  • You are familiar with at least one of the cloud computing platforms - GCP, AWS, Azure
  • You are well versed in software and AI development lifecycles, including ML Ops
  • You are agile and have a bias for action, removing roadblocks to get results fast

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • Masters or PhD degree in a quantitative field such as Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Engineering, or Data Science
  • Experience with agile methodology and work in a start-up environment
  • GCP or other cloud certifications
  • Experience with Bayesian / Belief Networks, and Causal Inference
  • Back end/API development experience
     

#DSEjobs

item.title: Data Scientist
item.description:
Our team and what we\'ll accomplish together


The Marketing, Strategy and Data Insights team supports TELUS Future Friendly Home (FFH) by unlocking the power of data and producing deep analytics to deliver actionable insights and generate value for our business and our customers. We are looking for someone passionate about data and new technologies to join our data science group and be a key player in our Machine Learning and AI journey. Always wanted to work with a team of innovators and be part of a culture that embraces creativity and collaboration? If so, we’d love to talk with you!


You’ll collaborate with teams across the company, seeking out innovative data sources such as speech analytics to help identify new business opportunities while championing data driven decision making and the accelerated adoption of AI. You will work closely with our marketing primes on the end to end journey, from ideation session for identification of use cases, to insights activation and monitoring of outcome.

 

As a Data Scientist on the team, you will leverage your expert knowledge of data science to automate and facilitate machine learning model development, training and deployment. The team takes pride in the Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning models and solutions they develop and deploy, and take ownership of each step of the process. From hypothesis generation, initial exploration of datasets, development of novel AI techniques, to automation of pipelines and ML models; be a leader in our cloud migration journey.

 

What you\'ll do

 

  • Lead the iterative development, validation, and deployment of AI/ML models
  • Collaborate on end-to-end automation efforts required to bring models to production
  • Work with structured and unstructured raw data to design and develop innovative predictive models, metrics, and dashboards to uncover actionable insights
  • Visualize and report data findings creatively in a variety of visual formats that provide insights to the organization
  • Influence how we approach business challenges and opportunities by driving the adoption of a data driven mindset
  • Develop re-usable code aimed at delivering on future goals faster and more reliably
  • Build and maintain a strong engagement with key stakeholders to understand business needs and priorities

What you bring

 

  • You are recognized for addressing business needs via your application of data mining and analysis, predictive modeling, statistics and other advanced analytical techniques in which you have previous hands-on work experience
  • You are sought out for your skills in Machine Learning and AI, including classification, clustering, time series analysis, NLP, predictive models and bring 3 or more years of hands-on work and practical business experience in the above areas
  • You are a master communicator capable of breaking down technical and complex concepts in a way that is understood by non-technical audiences
  • You have solid development experience with Python and you are comfortable using various data science libraries such as Scikit-learn, Pandas, Numpy as well as frameworks like TensorFlow, and have applied these skills towards solving actual business matters
  • You possess advanced knowledge in SQL and Apache Spark
  • You are familiar with at least one of the cloud computing platforms - GCP, AWS, Azure
  • You are agile and have a bias for action, removing roadblocks to get results fast

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • Masters or PhD degree in a quantitative field such as Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, or Data Science
  • GCP or other cloud certifications

#LI-REMOTE

item.title: Senior RF Design Specialist
item.description:
Description

 

Join our team and what we’ll accomplish together

The wireless engineering team is a group of highly motivated and talented RF Designers who have a passion for deploying the network infrastructure to achieve best in class network services to our customers. We are the team that engineer our 5G national RAN network.

The team is always at the cutting edge of wireless technology delivering the newest and the best services to our customers. With the advent of 5G, you will have the opportunity to work with peer RF Designers to design the network while leveraging your automation, data science, and machine learning skills.

TELUS is searching for a Designer with extensive experience in RF Design, strong business acumen and leadership skills. As a Senior RF Designer, you will collaborate closely with the client-facing business units offering solutions to future & existing customers in a variety of business different verticals. Your leadership and creativity will serve to understand the customer’s challenges and to design a technical solution that surpasses their expectations by leveraging all that 5G has to offer.

What you’ll do 

 

  • Using RF propagation modelling, you will develop novel techniques to simulate wireless coverage supporting the evolution of our networks (5G and IoT)
  • Collaborating with internal teams like Technology Strategy and Product Development to understand new technologies and services to prepare our team to succeed in an evolving business environment
  • Leveraging data analytics to define future network deployment strategy in a variety of business verticals.
  • Developing dashboards and data visualizations you will provide insight into network performance that can be shared with executives, peer groups and tools that are implemented in customer portals 
  • Keeping up-to-date with software, data science, and RF technologies while proposing new ideas for platforms and tools

 

 

Qualification


What you bring

 

  • Bachelor degree in Engineering ( Electrical or Computer) 
  • Advanced presentation & communication skills. The successful candidate will be called upon to present highly technical material in an easily digestible manner at all levels of the organization and to potential customers
  • Commended for your inter-personal skills, critical thinking, analytical, and problem solving skills
  • A minimum of 10-year minimum experience in an RF engineering team, with a deep insight of industry standard propagation tools (ex. Planet, ATOLL) 
  • Experience in designing macro sites, small cells & and in-building coverage solutions
  • A sound knowledge of 3GPP (5G/LTE/UMTS/HSPA) radio access network design, optimization and capacity engineering
  • A strong understanding of databases and big data including MySQL, NoSQL databases, SPLUNK, Python and Alteryx
  • Passionate about automation, data science, and machine learning

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • Master degree in Engineering or Computer Science
  • MBA or similar business training certifications
  • Knowledge of Tableau, Splunk or Alteryx

item.title: Lead Data Scientist - TELUS Insights
item.description:
Description

 

The IoT Industry Solutions team is "start-up" within TELUS that is focused on building end-to-end customer solutions that combine the strengths of our networks, leading SaaS and platform partnerships, our breadth of customer relationships, and the power of data insights. We own the success of focused vertical and horizontal IoT solutions across Intelligent Mobility, Connected Workers, Smart City, Agriculture, and Health.

We\'re passionate about building new business areas for TELUS and will succeed by bringing clarity and focus to the challenge. 

About the team

This role is part of the Data and Applied Intelligence team within IoT Industry Solutions. We are a provider of data, insights and data science services to commercial and government organizations. Our product solves many business problems across a wide variety of industries. They are currently being used in Tourism, Commercial Real Estate, Transportation and many other industries to help decision makers plan their next course of action or analyze their historical activities. We are a fun group of individuals, who are really passionate about our products and committed to provide quality solutions to our customers.

About the role

 

  • Design and build large and complex data sets, from spurious sources while thinking strategically about uses of data and how data use interacts with data design
  • Design and implement statistical data quality procedures for new data sources
  • Develop algorithms/software for accessing and handling data appropriately
  • Implement and hand off data checking and updating procedures to teams
  • Lead the new product developments for the TELUS Insights portfolio and product enhancements for existing location intelligence products
  • Scale the current custom consulting projects to a generalized product that could be reused for multiple clients across multiple verticals
  • Develop and implement ML & AI and Big Data solutions including predictive modeling,forecasting and classification
  • Visualize and report data findings creatively in a variety of visual formats that appropriately provides insights to the organization
  • Train others on what data is available and how to use various sources
  • Communicate findings to business leaders in a way that can influence how an organization approaches a business challenge
  • Support and evolve the TELUS Insights product roadmap by leveraging customer insights, industry research, best practices, and emerging tools/technology
  • Identify opportunities for process/model optimization and refine to improve effectiveness/accuracy and enhance ROI
  • Collaborate with Data Scientists and Data Engineers within TELUS as well as external Data Science communities

 

 

Qualifications

 

You\'re the missing piece of the puzzle

 

  • You have 5+ years of experience working with large temporal geospatial datasets
  • MSc. or PhD/Research in Computer Science, Statistics, Geospatial etc. 
  • You possess deep expertise in location intelligence/ Geospatial data
  • Working with structured and unstructured data sets
  • Excellent skills working with complex SQL and Spark
  • Experience developing in Python; comfortable using various data science libraries such as Scikit-learn, Pandas, Numpy as well as frameworks like TensorFlow, Pytorch, Keras
  • Experience building and architecting API endpoints
  • Experience working with telecom background is a plus
  • Experience working with cloud environments like GCP 
  • You are recognized for addressing business needs via your application of data mining and analysis, predictive modeling, statistics, and other advanced analytical techniques
  • You are sought out for your skills in Machine Learning, Classification, Clustering, Segmentation, Time Series Analysis, Demand Forecasting and Optimization
  • Evaluating and providing input on potential business intelligence solutions.
  • Comfortable with Jupyter environment and infrastructure, Spyder/PyCharm
  • Experience with at least one of the major cloud computing platforms - GCP, AWS, Azure
  • Well versed in software development lifecycle and ML Ops concepts; Developing end-end to models/ projects and automation in production environment.
  • Knowledgeable about common supervised and unsupervised Machine Learning approaches (eg. feature engineering, classification, regression, clustering, NLP, time series forecasting, etc. "Tensorflow”, “Deep Learning” and synthetic tabular data generation is a strong asset

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • PhD in a quantitative field such as Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, or Data Science
  • Data visualization experience: Data Studio, Tableau, PowerBI, Domo
  • Data environments experience: MS SQL, Oracle
  • Experience using Google Workspace 
  • Experience with agile methodology and team-based software development workflows (e.g. JIRA)

 

MBIOT22 #LI-HYBRID #LI-rEMOTE

item.title: Senior Product Owner, AI Products & Platform | TELUS Digital
item.description:
Description


Join our team 

The AI Products & Platform team is an agile team focused on building machine learning applications which enable dynamic experiences that adapt to the behaviour of our customers. Some of the solutions we’ve worked on include product & article recommendation, fraud detection, lead scoring and natural language analysis. Our team of data scientists, analysts and engineers allows us to build end to end solutions from data ingestion to model serving.

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together 

As a Product Owner on the AI Products & Platform team, you will be responsible to enable TELUS team members to understand how machine learning can be embedded into customer interactions to drive business benefits such as RGUs and self-serve benefits. To do this, you will manage stakeholder requirements & documentations, drive data privacy processes, and facilitate cross-collaboration effort of both technical and business team members across organization. 

This is a full-time, permanent position. Remote work is available anywhere in Canada.  #LI-Remote
 

Here’s how: 
 

  • Drive AI Products and Platform maturity with TELUS by designing machine learning solutions working with our data science, analytics, and ML Ops Engineering teams
  • Develop roadmap for various AI enablement and analytical use cases to deliver tangible EBIDTA or opex effort reduction business outcomes
  • Business casing to project the value of embedding machine learning solutions into different areas of the business
  • Partner with teams within TELUS Digital and wider TELUS to ensure our team drives what’s needed to fulfill both short- and long-term company goals
  • Overseeing, assisting, and prioritizing team’s in-flight workload and backlog of user stories that will drive customer value and help reduce customer effort
  • Focus on outcomes, working through ambiguity & delivering with a "no task is too big or too small" attitude
  • Having a healthy obsession for finding “better ways” to do things


 

Qualifications


You\'re the missing piece of the puzzle: 
 

  • Known for your intellectual curiosity, grit, and a genuine passion for solving problems with machine learning and predictive analytics
  • A knack for building interpersonal relationships with a variety of stakeholders ( Both business and technical)
  • Familiar with JIRA, Confluence, Waterfall and Agile SDLC practices in order to support Developers, Tech Leads, PO’s, Architects, Analysts
  • You are an entrepreneur and self-motivating, with experience leading product departments
  • You use both quantitative and qualitative research to improve the product
  • Ability to influencing without authority when managing complex, cross-functional programs


 

Great-to-haves
 

  • Foundational knowledge of machine learning and Google Cloud Platform
  • Ability to perform ad-hoc data analysis to quantify various metrics
  • Understanding of the digital landscape and data analytics tools and trends
  • Post-secondary education in related disciplines such as digital, business/marketing, AI, analytics



About TELUS Digital

 

 

Who we are:

We’re a customer-driven and product-minded team within TELUS, responsible for our company’s digital evolution. We simplify the path to production so teams can focus on what matters most. 
 

TELUS Digital’s mission is to make life easier for millions of customers – and for our team. We build smart, customer-centric and data-driven experiences for telus.com, business.telus.com and the My Account app.
 

Our team includes a passionate group of strategists, UX and visual designers, full stack developers, content managers, scrum masters, testers, product owners, people experience specialists, and other digital experts. 
 

Our team members are leaders in local and global technology communities, we value and support communities such as: Tech Masters, NodeSchool, Ladies Learning Code, Women Who Code TO and many more!
 

Learn more about our team at telus.com/digital

 


We want to work with people who:
 

  • Share our passion for all things digital
  • Thrive in an agile, lean and fast-paced environment
  • Clearly see things from the perspective of our customers
  • Are curious, experiment and never stop learning
  • View collaboration as essential to your work
  • Utilize the power of data to inform decisions
  • Embrace diversity and new ideas

 


What you can expect from us:
 

  • An environment where you’re encouraged to share and act on your ideas
  • Flexible work hours in a remote first, mobile environment
  • A welcoming, relaxed office environment
  • A culture committed to giving; every year we donate time and resources in our communities
  • A fun, dynamic team that works and plays every day; great ideas can come as easily during an impromptu hallway soccer match or social team outing

 


Bonus points

Check out https://telus.com/digital/blog to see how we solve challenging problems for millions of customers with innovative tools.

item.title: DevOps Engineer - Wireless Core Network
item.description:
Join our team and what we’ll accomplish together

 

The Wireless Core Network Services DevOps team is at the forefront of driving strategy for the next generation of networks and technologies such as 4G, 5G, IoT, AI, and Virtualization. This team gets involved with the fundamentals of what the strategy is and how we can achieve it. Team Members are often considered innovators as they develop and enhance network designs aimed at improving client service reliability for core mobility services. The team incorporates passion and technical prowess to be highly effective in their risk mitigation and delivery. Often being met by difficult decisions, they remain invested in what they do and believe in what they are creating for the future.


As a DevOps Engineer, you will drive strategy for 4G, 5G, Consumer Security and the automation program for our core network infrastructure and services. Your creativity coupled with strong automation, data science, machine learning, and computer networking skills will allow us to find the most efficient ways of building and maintaining our wireless core network to support existing mobility infrastructure and offer new services.

 

You will exercise your entrepreneurial spirit and creative vision to change the way TELUS leverages technology. Collectively, the passion we have to transform the Network landscape will remain a leading factor in why customers continue to recognize TELUS as the fastest and most reliable network in Canada.

What you’ll do

 

Investigate and implement opportunities to leverage automation for the mobility core network and services

 

  • Implement machine learning algorithms and develop system APIs
  • Develop quality solutions through adherence to coding standards and test automation
  • Support the delivery of Technology and Automation specific programs
  • Participate in creation of technical design documentation: Detail design and architecture documents 
  • Participate in operational improvement initiatives, in conjunction with other technology teams in the company

 

 

What you bring

 

  • 3+ years of relevant professional experience
  • Bachelor degree in Computer Science or Engineering
  • Familiar with Agile and CI/CD pipeline
  • Experience in the wireless core network, especially EPC (Evolved Packet Core – PGW, MME, DRA), IoT, NFV, SDN, 5G UPF, AMF, SMF
  • Experience in wireless core security (Firewall)
  • Knowledge and experience of deploying software in virtual environments such as OpenStack, OpenShift, or containerization using Kubernetes
  • Experience working on Linux operating systems and cloud computing platforms such as Red Hat, Open Stack and/or VMWare
  • Strong capabilities of data mining, machine learning and API design
  • Good understanding of computer technologies and architectures including TCP/IP, O/S, layer 2 and 3 networks, SNMP and MIB
  • Familiar with 3G and 4G core network technologies (UMTS & LTE)
  • Demonstrated experience in building strong relationships with key stakeholders including senior management across the technology and partnering organizations


Great-to-haves

 

  • Master’s degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering
  • Professional certifications: Red Hat (RHCE), Openstack (COA), and Routing & Switching
  • Experience in network systems & process automation using DevOps tools and programming/scripting languages such as JavaScript, PowerShell, Python, Unix shell, Ansible, Jenkins, GitLAB
  • Knowledge and experience of 5G SA core is preferred

item.title: Design Specialist II

The Wireless Core Network Services DevOps team is at the forefront of driving strategy for the next generation of networks and technologies such as 5G, IoT, AI, and Virtualization. This team gets involved with the fundamentals of what the strategy is and how we can achieve it. Team Members are often considered innovators as they develop and enhance network designs aimed at improving client service reliability for core mobility services.
