item.title: Data Science Solutions Consultant - Location Analytics Product
item.description:
Description

 

The IoT Industry Solutions team is "start-up" within TELUS that is focused on building end-to-end customer solutions that combine the strengths of our networks, leading SaaS and platform partnerships, our breadth of customer relationships, and the power of data insights. We own the success of focused vertical and horizontal IoT solutions across Intelligent Mobility, Connected Workers, Smart City, Agriculture, and Health.

We\'re passionate about building new business areas for TELUS and will succeed by bringing clarity and focus to the challenge. 

About the team

The Data Science Solutions Consultant plays a key role in the TELUS Insights - Data and Applied Intelligence team within IoT Industry Solutions. We are a provider of data, insights and data science services to commercial and government organizations. Our product solves many business problems across a wide variety of industries. They are currently being used in Tourism, Commercial Real Estate, Transportation and many other industries to help decision makers plan their next course of action or analyze their historical activities. 

The successful candidate will directly work with TELUS Customers of our Location Analytics product, analyze customers’ business and technical requirements to find solutions that can be provided from the suite of product offerings within the product suite. This role also supports the sales team and data science team with presales, project delivery, project management and customer engagements. . 

We are a fun group of individuals, who are really passionate about our products and committed to provide quality solutions to our customers.
 

Key Responsibilities

 

  • Presales Support
    • Lead and support the full customer lifecycle of projects from presales to client delivery with the support of sales team and Data Scientists
    • Works closely with the Sales team to understand the customer requirements, present the product offerings, perform feasibility studies and prepare the scope of the project
    • Respond to RFIs, RFQs, RFPs, etc., prepare solution diagrams, technical descriptions, and presentation materials for prospective customers
    • Translate complex technical information into compelling and easy-to-understand business propositions
  • Project Management
    • Prepare the Statement of Work (SOW), agreements, response to RFPs as needed for all clients supporting the Sales team
    • Prepare and manage the individual project plan including the scope, deliverables and the timeline 
    • Work closely with the sales team and the finance team to ensure the billing and transactions are managed at the appropriate schedule
  • Project Delivery
    • Act as liaison between the customer team and data science teams once the project agreement is signed
    • Collaborate with the Data Scientists to prepare the client presentations, present the insights and findings and close the project deliveries
    • Prepare the visualizations and report data findings on presentations to support the client delivery 
  • Customer Management
    • Identify opportunities for customer upsell, customer satisfaction and customer retention and community to the sales team
  • General Responsibilities
    • Identify new product opportunities and ideas during discussions with the customers and communicate with the product team on an ongoing basis
    • Stay up-to-date on new developments in the industry and compare TELUS products and services with those offered by the competition
    • Maintain a high level of technical knowledge related to your field of expertise
    • Collaborate with Data Scientists and Data Engineers within TELUS as well as external Data Science communities

 

 

Qualifications

 

You\'re the missing piece of the puzzle

 

  • Excellent skills in communication, presentation and storytelling, including preparing and presenting powerpoints, reports and visualizations with technical as well as business experts
  • You have 5+ years of experience working in a consulting role with stakeholders from public and private sector preferably in a location analytics project
  • MSc. or Bachelors in Computer Science, Statistics, Geospatial or MBA etc
  • Prior experience as a Data Scientist, GeoSpatial Developer, and/or Business Intelligence Specialist 
  • Experience working with technical products that offer solutions through dashboards, APIs, Maps etc
  • Have a good understanding of geospatial data or has the ability to quickly learn the nitty gritty details of a location analytics product
  • Intermediate knowledge of Python, SQL and comfortable using various data science libraries such as Scikit-learn, Pandas, Numpy 
  • You are recognized for addressing business needs via your application of data mining and analysis, predictive modeling, statistics, and other advanced analytical techniques
  • Evaluating and providing input on potential business intelligence solutions
  • Comfortable with Jupyter environment and infrastructure, Spyder/PyCharm
  • Well versed in software development lifecycle and automation in production environment
  • Knowledgeable about common supervised and unsupervised Machine Learning approaches such as feature engineering, classification, regression, clustering, NLP, time series forecasting, etc

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • Knowledge of Geospatial visualization tools like QGIS
  • Data visualization experience: Data Studio, Tableau, PowerBI, Domo
  • Data environments experience: MS SQL, Oracle
  • Experience using Google Workspace 
  • Experience with agile methodology and team-based software development workflows (e.g. JIRA)
  • Experience working with telecom background is a plus
  • Experience working with cloud environments like GCP is a plus

 

#LI-Remote #LI-HYBRID MBIOT22

item.title: Senior Design Specialist - Cloud RAN Data Scientist
item.description:
Description


Join our team and what we\'ll accomplish together

 

The latest Open RAN (Radio Access Network) technology brings not only BBU (baseband unit) couldifications & virtualization, open interfaces between DU (Distributed Unit) and RU(Radio Unit) , but also introduces and enables ORAN intelligent automation platform namely SMO (Service Management and Orchestration) with RIC (RAN intelligent Controller) which applies automation at scale to simplify the complexity of ORAN networks, as well as improve network performance, enhance customer experience and minimize ORAN operational costs with ORAN analytics and assurance. 

 

Introducing TELUS’ new Cloud RAN automation platform DevOps team which will oversee the development, operations and evolution of ORAN SMO and RIC. We are embracing disruption, reimagining network services capabilities, and driving growth. We see great value in bringing Cloud, IP/MPLS, data analytics and software development professionals into this team in addition to RAN knowledge to not only develop these platforms but also enhance the systems. 

 

As a Data Scientist working closely with various stakeholders including TELUS’ Chief Technology Office, ORAN DevOps team, and external vendors, you play a critical role in enabling ORAN intelligent operations by developing automation policies and algorithms, workflow and data processing services.

 

What you’ll do

  • Lead the development of ORAN data processing workflow, as well as data pipelines system design and configurations to ensure ORAN data availability and integrity to end users
  • Responsible for ORAN SMO (service management and orchestration) platform design and technology development, drive vendor’s SMO roadmap to align with TELUS’s ORAN automation strategies
  • Responsible for ORAN RIC (RAN intelligent Controller) platform design and technology development
  • Create ORAN automation policies & rules, templates & algorithms and workflow services for ORAN full stack automation, including server Bare Metal, xHaul, CaaS, and vDU/vCU services. 
  • Develop ORAN-Cloud orchestration and federation solutions including ORAN IMS (Infrastructure Management Services) and DMS (Deployment management Services)
  • Responsible for ORAN Software and Hardware Life Cycle Management solution development and introduction
  • Define TELUS RIC model and algorithm standards for new xApp and rApp onboarding
  • Lead the integration with TELUS overarching remedy’s and systems
  • Lead platform system issue troubleshooting and integration 
  • Drive Open SMO integration with TELUS’s selected vRAN solutions
  • Technology introduction of evolutionary ORAN OAM (FCAPS) via streaming telemetry
  • Lead SMO/RIC platform AI (Artificial Intelligent)/ML (Machine Learning) workflow services design and technology introduction

Qualifications


What you bring

  • Working experiences with LTE, 5G NSA (Non-stand alone) and SA (Standalone) RAN (Radio access network) technology and Telco OSS system
  • Experience in Requirements Engineering, Solution Architecture, Design, Development and Deployment Experience in Underlying infrastructure for Big Data Solutions (Clustered/Distributed Computing, Storage, Data Center Networking) 
  • Expertise in NiFi setup and administration 
  • Expertise in design, development, and configuration of data processing and ETL workflow
  • Expertise in design and development using Spark, Spark Streaming, Kafka, etc.
  • Familiarity with the telecommunication industry wireless access DevOps workflows of design, plan, deployment, change management and operations. 
  • Understanding of the various phases of the Software Development Life Cycle and familiarity using Source Code and Version Control systems 
  • Expertise in one or more programming languages and data formats such as Java, Python, GO, XML, YAML, Shell Scripting, JSON, RESTful APIs etc. 
  • Experience with managed Kubernetes services such as Google’s Kubernetes Engine (GKE), Amazon’s Elastic Kubernetes Service (EKS), RedHat OpenShift, WindRiver Cloud platform, Robin.io cloud platform.
  • Experience on managing and developing cloud-native containerized micro services
  • Experience on Kubernetes cloud analytics tools (such as Beats, Logstash, Elasticsearch, Kibana, Kafka and/or Prometheus)
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with an ability to translate complex technical concepts to non-technical audiences
  • A Bachelor or Master Degree in Electrical/computer engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems

 

Great-to-haves 

  • 5G RAN cell site deployment automation development experiences, including workflow engine, inventory databases
  • Familiarity with Open-RAN and ETSI specifications and standards
  • Multi or hybrid cloud architectures
  • Experience with Big Data & Analytics tools such as Hadoop MapReduce, Spark, Big Query, DataFlow etc.
  • Experience with AI/ML toolkits such as Tensor flow, Mllib, H2Oai, Kubeflow etc
  • Working experience on IP/MPLS and Kubernetes networking technologies such as VxLAN, Calico, CNI, M-Lag, EVPN etc.

 

ORANJobs *LI-remote *LI-hybrid

item.title: Senior Product/Project Manager - Collaborative Health
item.description:
Join our team

 

TELUS Health is transforming healthcare by delivering connected solutions and services to empower people to live healthier lives.

 

We are explorers and passionate system thinkers. We are builders and dedicated craftspeople. We are connectors and agents of change. Our thinking is grounded in an appreciation for relentless discovery, and a holistic view of the industry, market, or organization. Our efforts are grounded in a sincere commitment to translate insight into opportunity, opportunity into concepts, concepts into products and products into businesses.  We achieve this with a dedication to our craft and collaboration at our core.

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

At TELUS SKY, we’ve developed a future thinking integrated ecosystem for true health, wellness and behavioral care that bridges in-person and virtual experiences. Specifically, the SKY Experience assembles people, technologies and science into a single intuitive process that combines the best of premium in-person experiences with a seamless digital platform. By doing so, we are building one of the richest databases of wellbeing biomarkers, physical, psychological, sociological indicators. Combined with advancements in artificial intelligence (AI), we will have the ability to reexamine standard assumptions of care to impact individual health journeys.

 

We are currently looking for a blend of Senior Product / Project Manager to create a frictionless digital experience, working very closely with the Sr UX / CX experience designer. In this position, you will work with cross-functional teams to analyze business requirements, research, design, integrate, and deploy new technologies. The Senior Product/Project Manager will also manage effective relationships with internal stakeholders, regional partners, technology vendors and service providers.

 

 

What you’ll do: 

 

 

  • Create and drive the integration strategy and roadmap to connect various platforms in order to provide an end to end seamless customer experience
  • Contribute to the creation of a multi-year product strategy and roadmap for SKY that expertly balances innovation with reinforcing our commitments to members
  • Work closely together with the various TELUS LoB strategy, design and product teams to identify technological integration opportunities and align on strategies, roadmaps, priorities and dependencies that provide direct business value to our SKY members.
  • Lead the execution of the developed project roadmap
  • Partner with cross-functional Product and Developer teams and industry experts to explore how Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning (AI/ML) technologies can better support our journey.
  • Work with our data science team to create a roadmap for future automated actions based on ML models
  • Facilitate, communicate, collaborate, negotiate between customer and technical teams to bring features to closure

What you bring:

 

  • You have 2+ years of Product or 7 + years of Project Management experience, ideally in SaaS
  • You are obsessed with delivering the most customer-centric experience, showing proven success in ownership, bias for action, and thinking big.
  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science or a relevant field, or equivalent certifications and work experience
  • Visionary, innovative, forward-thinking and profoundly customer focused
  • The flexibility to quickly adapt and produce in a rapidly changing environment, meeting aggressive product launch schedules
  • Track record working in high-growth environments, and a comfort level with the pace of change and level of ambiguity that accompanies this
  • Ability to work independently. Self-starter, can-do attitude, ability to multitask and prioritize within and across complex projects
  • Strong relationship development skills - experienced in building and strengthening internal and external relationships over time, savvy at navigating negotiations and tradeoffs with current and prospective partners
  • Broad interest in healthcare innovation that spans digital, hardware/devices, and healthcare services

 

 

Why TELUS Health?

 

At TELUS, Collaborative Health you’ll join a diverse team dedicated to learning, teaching, and impact; as individuals and as a team. As a workplace, we care about our team members and have a total rewards package that makes being a part of TELUS Health something to be proud of:

 

  • 100% remote within Canada: so you can work where you feel most inspired (in-person if YOU want to!)
  • Stay healthy: flex benefits with options to customize coverage based on your lifestyle and needs, inclusively offering coverage for Gender Affirmation and Fertility treatments
  • Virtual Care: premium access to digital healthcare for you and a loved one; avoid long waits at the clinic, just chat with a medical professional from your couch
  • Work Life Integration: paid vacation and flexible well-being days
  • Family leave: mothers, fathers and adoptive parents benefit from a top-up during part of their leave
  • Pension plan: to help you save for the future with a generous company match (free money!)
  • Employee Share Purchase Plan: you can invest in our shared success, company matched
  • Wellness Spending Account: To support your whole person wellness
  • Learning and development: Internal resources for business, leadership, and technical skills 
  • Savings: who doesn’t love discounts? (on TELUS services and partner/supplier services and products)
  • Employee and family assistance: LifeWorks provides free services to support you through life events
  • Tools/Technology: Mac or PC, whichever enables you to do your best work

 

#LI-Remote

item.title: Design Specialist II - RAN Development
item.description:
Join our team and what we’ll accomplish together

 

This is an opportunity to join a highly technical, dynamic team during a transformational journey. The RAN Development & New Service Introduction team is a group of highly motivated engineers who have a passion for developing and implementing new technologies to support our customers increasing demand for wireless service.

You will have the opportunity not only to influence the introduction of new technologies and leverage your expertise of modern engineering best practices, including automation and machine learning but also to build a wireless network that delivers continued award-winning customer experiences.

 

What you’ll do 

 

  • Responsible for LTE and 5G RAN network hardware, software, and feature new technology introduction
  • Proactively Communicate/clarify TELUS requirements to vendors and evaluates responses
  • Translate LTE/5G technical aspects into business impact and vice versa, plus E2E integration requirement 
  • Propose solutions and features optimization engineering guidelines, provide support for field teams
  • Plan the execution of the TELUS strategy and get involved in the execution 
  • Validate vendor compliance to industry/TELUS standards and the functional and performance requirements by conducting lab proof of concept and interoperability testing with other systems, etc
  • Communicate and present cross-team to explain the technical decisions and their outcomes
  • Apply a ‘Reliability by design’ approach during the new technology planning and rollout steps

What you bring

 

Solid knowledge of LTE/5G RF design and optimization (5+ years’ experience)
Understand future network technology evolution: HeNet (small cell), AI & Machine learning, MEC, 5G Network slicing, and SDN/virtualization, Cloud technology
Familiar with 3GPP spec., including air interface implementation, RRM, MM, and RF compliance
Understand basic knowledge of IP, Video streaming, Multicast, and other networking protocols
Hands-on experience with the network/performance testing tools such as IXIA, SmartBits, Chariot, QXDM, Agilent drive testing tool, XCAL, TEMS, and Actix tool IP based application knowledge and exposure to network security would also be assets
5 or more years performing lab testing evaluations including and not limited to proof of concept. Experience in writing test plans for different scenarios, collecting requirements from users
Ability to provide on-demand, specialized technical advice for the technical solution of several wide-ranging problems and to interact with others including on a proactive customer-focused basis
Familiar with wireless network troubleshooting procedure and performance enhancement process with knowledge related
 

Great-to-haves

 

Master degree in telecom 
P.Eng or Eng designation

item.title: DevOps Engineer - Cyber Security Data Lake Team
item.description:
Join our team

 

We are looking for a DevOps engineer for our cyber security data lake team.

 

The Argus Security Data lake provides big data analytics and Machine Learning capabilities for our security analysts.  Our data lake is used not only to help our response teams investigate incidents but for building machine learning models that help detect suspicious behaviour in our networks and our clients networks.  Our team collaborates with universities and other organizations in research projects to expand our knowledge and capabilities.

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

As a Devops engineer we need someone who is both a programmer and a systems admin.  Our team maintains a data lake of system logs that our cybersecurity team uses for investigations.  Our devops engineers are required to maintain the systems in the cluster as well as deploying changes and upgrades.  You will be required to work on call on a rotational basis.  You need to have a troubleshooting mindset that can diagnose problems as they are happening.  Help us protect the assets of our clients by keeping our platform performing at its best. This role is a work from home position, you will need to have decent home internet access.  We accept candidates from across Canada as long as they can come into a Telus regional office if needed on occasion.

 

Here’s how

 

  • Ability to work from home with a reliable home internet connection
  • Maintain the data analytics platform by facilitating upgrades and troubleshooting
  • Monitor and troubleshoot system and data issues when they happen
  • Work in an on call rotation to provide support outside of business hours
  • Work closely with our data engineers on deploying upgrades to the platform
  • Be part of an agile team and contribute to discussions on a daily basis

You\'re the missing piece of the puzzle

 

  • Post secondary education in information technology
  • Working knowledge of Unix/Linux command line, Computer Networks, systems development
  • Experience with python, bash scripting, Cron jobs, Gitlab and/or Github
  • Experience working in Agile development teams, familiarity with SDLC 
  • Ability to work outside of normal working hours on call
  • Nice to have: GCP certification or experience
  • Nice to have: experience working with Hadoop and Kafka

Join our team and what we\'ll accomplish together

 

We are looking for a DevOps engineer for our cyber security data lake.

 

The Argus Security Data lake provides big data analytics and Machine Learning capabilities for our security analysts.  Our data lake is used not only to help our response teams investigate incidents but for building machine learning models that help detect suspicious behavior in our networks and our clients networks.  Our team collaborates with universities and other organizations in research projects to expand our knowledge and capabilities.

item.title: Full Stack Software Developer
item.description:
Description

 

Be a part of a transformational journey with innovative talent and leading edge technologies.
 

Our team and what we’ll accomplish together

 

The Reliability Data Engineering and Analytics Team at TELUS focusses on instantaneous detection of events that could lead to incidents, outages and negatively impact the customer experience.

 

As a Full Stack Software Developer, your innovative mindset, technical skills, and passion for growth will be critical in continuing to grow our data analytics practices for predictive insights and early detection of incidents. Be a part of the team that uses cutting edge technology to implement machine learning and predictive analytics which will shape tomorrow\'s AI Ops. 

 

What you’ll do

 

  • Collaborating with other designers, engineers and DevOps team members
  • Creating beautiful and fast code that improves our code base in meaningful ways
  • Using test-driven development to write well-tested codes
  • Fixing bugs fast and solving hard problems well
  • Curiosity and passion to constantly learn new things

 

Qualifications

 

What you bring

 

  • University Degree/Diploma in Computer Science or Engineering
  • 2 years’ experience using GCP cloud monitoring and logging
  • 1 year hands on experience with Looker development
  • At least 1+ years’ experience working with Big Query
  • At least 1+ years’ experience with CI/CD pipeline, can create Terraform scripts
  • Knowledge/experience working with Linux (Red Hat Enterprise/CentOS) and Windows, in a DevOps environment and Splunk
  • Knowledge of Agile, Test-Driven Development and Continuous Deployment

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • Relational databases and SQL
  • Networking protocols
  • SDN technologies, virtualization environment and Docker containers
  • NiFi flow development
  • Redshift/ Snowflake

item.title: Solution Architect
item.description:
Description


Join our team and what we\'ll accomplish together

 

The Data Strategy & Enablement team is on a continuous journey towards helping TELUS become a world-class leader in data solutions, doing so by delivering data analytics capabilities built upon unified scalable platforms, advanced AI tooling, high quality data, and a data-product and data platform oriented culture while always keeping an eye on the horizon, preparing for the next big thing.

 

We are entrepreneurial and passionate, believers that so much more is possible and can be achieved by creating value and great outcomes for our customers, team members, communities, and environment and that through meaningful transformation we can integrate dynamic change in our professional lives.

 

The Data Strategy and Enablement team has started its journey towards enabling further digital transformation in our data and advanced analytics space. Composed of Data Engineers, Business Systems Analysts and Architects our team focuses on building and enabling best-in-class data platforms with a focus on migrating our assets from an on premise data lake to Google’s Cloud Platform.

 

Join a dynamic team that is paving the way towards digital transformation and enable teams across the organization to make better use of data. Make use of your analytical skills and ability to analyze and assess the impact of data on upstream and downstream systems and help clarify and define cloud-related business processes and best practices across TELUS. Help architect the transformation and modernization of our enterprise data solutions and the integration of Google Cloud and native GCP services and 3rd party data technologies.
 

What you’ll do     

 

  • Collaborate with both technology and business partners and domain architects in order to design robust enterprise grade solutions
  • Document various solution options and recommend the best approach balancing constraints and future needs
  • Propose solutions to enable business objectives while advancing enterprise tech strategies
  • Identify opportunities for and implement automation in the development and production process to reduce upfront hands-on work
  • Capture issues with the data that impact key business drivers and relay them to the product management teams
  • Support the data pipelines feeding into our machine learning algorithms and models
  • Participate in requirements review sessions or attend intake assessment meetings to estimate effort for high-level solutions
     

Qualifications


What you bring

 

  • You are recognized for your 10+ years of experience of IT platform implementation in a technical capacity
  • You bring systems design experience with the ability to architect and explain complex systems interactions, data flows, common interfaces and APIs
  • You have an architecture level understanding of APIs, security architecture, and cloud native development on one of the major cloud providers (GCP, Azure, AWS)
  • You have experience with designing, developing, and operationalizing high-volume back-end web applications
  • You have experience with REST API design
  • You have strong proficiency with JavaScript and understand the nature of asynchronous programming

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • GCP experience and certification
  • Experienced in working with NodeJS

item.title: Cloud Engineer (Remote)
item.description:
Description


Join our team and what we\'ll accomplish together

The Data Platforms team is the hub of analytics at TELUS.  So much so that our future forward solution is known as Data Hub.  Our team architects and operationalizes the underlying infrastructure used to power data solutions that drive value and deliver results from analytics. Our platforms provide the ability to put data into motion through batch and real-time processes to bring data from on-premise systems to cloud platforms. Our cloud presence allows TELUS teams to make use of cloud native functionality to drive reporting and developing machine learning models.  The sky\'s the limit.

We are looking for technical enthusiasts who can help build our next generation solution. Together we will build and enable best-in-class data platforms with a focus on expanding our capabilities while ensuring always available analytics in Google’s Cloud Platform.
 
Enable teams across the organization to make better use of data. Use your analytical skills and ability to assess the impact of data on upstream and downstream systems and help clarify and define cloud-related business processes and best practices across TELUS. Help architect the transformation and modernization of our enterprise data solutions and the integration of Google Cloud and native GCP services and 3rd party data technologies.

 

Here\'s How

 

  • Work with and listen to business and technical teams to understand their needs
  • Define the ideal data flow and drive process and architecture changes to make it happen by collaborating with their owners
  • Design and implement solutions to move data across systems and locations
  • Collaborate kindly and proactively with the rest of our team and our customers (internal teams at TELUS)
  • Take solutions from concept to production by using 3rd party tools, writing code, config, and scripts
  • Identify opportunities for automation and implement in the development and production process
  • Provision and maintain existing platforms to facilitate growth and stability
  • Author quality documentation for any solutions implemented on both how they were implemented and how to use them #DSEjobs

Qualifications

 

What you bring

 

  • You are kind and want to make things better for others in collaboration with others
  • You have experience with cloud-native technologies, such as Terraform
  • You have experience with the flow of data between systems 
  • You can design and deploy distributed, multi-technology, data processing systems
  • You have used cloud platforms such as Google Cloud for application hosting
  • You have experience with YAML and/or JSON for configuration
  • You can explain complex systems interactions, data flows, common interfaces, and APIs
  • You understand that system stability drives availability and customer trust
  • You are able to provision infrastructure and secure & reliable services and applications in the cloud
  • You are able to provide guidance to optimize data collection, storage, and consumption by choosing the right platforms and tools for the right use cases
  • You have experience supporting and maintaining production environments
  • You have good understanding of DevOps & DataOps principles and tools
  • You don’t deploy to production on Fridays

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • Hands-on familiarity with at least one of: Kafka, Google Pub/Sub, NiFi
  • Experience with Google’s BigQuery service
  • Understanding of DevOps, DataOps principles and tools
  • Data Warehousing design experience
  • Familiarity with monitoring, alerts, and logging solution

item.title: Manager-Technology Strategy - Wireless Core Network and Services DevOps
item.description:
Description

 

Join our team

 

TELUS’ Wireless Core Network & Services Dev/Ops team is responsible architecture, deployment, optimization, and operations for technology platforms that support the national wireless core network. We have a unique opportunity for an engaging people leader to manage a software development team.

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

You will lead a team of engineers and software developers to transform to virtualized network functions, softwarize network services, and improve service reliability across core platforms. The team will work with our industry partners, both telco vendors and hyperscalers, to develop and operate wireless services including but not limited to system integration, software development, data analytics and automation. Your management skills, industry knowledge and technological leadership will shape TELUS’ next-generation networks and services.  Moreover, your natural abilities to collaborate with other teams such as Product and Sales will set you apart.

 

Here’s how

 

  • Coach, develop and inspire a diverse team of DevOps professionals
  • Solve problems and handle escalation in a collaborative and effective manner 
  • Set key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure individual and team successes
  • Build trust and partnership with internal/external stakeholders and lead customers
  • Develop and operate software solutions based on virtualized infrastructure and 5G 
  • Focus on reliability across critical user journeys
  • Using Agile engineering principles, you will lead the efforts to quickly adapt to new technologies, services and applications
  • With a constant focus on customer experience and industry trends, you will lead on-going improvements to our core to ensure the best customer experience every time, everywhere
  • Manage platform lifecycles, 3-year service roadmap and Capex/Opex budgets
  • Adopt principals of Reliability by Design, Security by Design and Privacy by Design

 

 

Qualifications

 

You’re the missing piece of the puzzle

 

  • Respected as a collaborative partner and trusted advisor who builds strong relationships across the organization and providing value add
  • Regarded as an excellent communicator, negotiator and influencer, able to communicate complex ideas and concepts to a variety of audiences including senior leaders in a clear, simple, easy to understand manner
  • Recognized for your Customer First mindset and delivering on optimal outcomes for both internal and external stakeholders
  • Sought out for your strategic thinking, business acumen, sound decision making and result-driven mindset with the ability to take initiative and ownership of complex issues through to resolution
  • Solid knowledge and understanding of:
    • Application integration models and methodologies
    • Agile development and DevOps methodologies
    • Application Development environments and technologies for delivering digital solutions
    • Software development and coding techniques 
    • Cloud native technologies and concepts
  • Proven business, financial and strategic skills with experience in assessing alternatives and business case development
  • Noted to have a high degree of curiosity, continuously learning new topics, concepts and technologies, and also looking beyond the surface level to understand the full picture and questioning/challenge the status-quo resulting to drive higher business value
  • Respected for your advanced knowledge of 3GPP (IMS/LTE/UMTS/HSPA) wireless core networks optimization and performance
  • Ability to interact with technical team members and distill complex ambiguous problems into actionable items
  • Experience negotiating with vendors for new technology and support agreements
  • Broad base of knowledge across IT and Network systems, support and processes
  • Bachelor\'s degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field and/or relevant experience

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • Big data correlation and machine learning knowledge
  • Experience in web/mobile applications development
  • Master of Engineering degree and/or MBA

item.title: Splunk/New Relic Developer
item.description:
Description


Join our team

With the convergence of innovative home and mobile networking technologies including fiber and 5G, smart home solutions, mobile devices, automation, cloud computing and over-the-top capabilities, our customers’ homes look very different in today’s digital world. Every day, TELUS’ engineering and development teams are envisioning what the future holds and building the technologies to simplify our customers’ lives, provide services at the touch of a button and create immersive entertainment experiences. ffhjobs

We are the Future Friendly Home Services DevOps group, and we are looking for Splunk/New Relic developers to join our team! We are responsible for the end-to-end technology development and operations of TELUS’ Optik TV services, video and over-the-top services, broadband network capabilities, smart home solutions and software-defined wide area network (SD-WAN) solutions. As a Splunk/New Relic developer, you will help us drive a large scale digital transformation program. It’s an exciting time to be a part of our mission to drive better outcomes through customer-centric, state-of-the-art software platforms.


Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

  • Contribute to an inclusive, knowledgeable and highly motivated team, using SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework) practices to frequently deliver valuable software to market
  • Unlock the power of cloud-native environments, having the freedom to leverage innovative technologies and the latest standards
  • Help drive a high-performance DevOps culture
  • Become a go-to expert on the code components you are responsible for and how they fit into the overall architecture, promoting a seamless solution
  • Power future possibilities for our customers and advance a compelling portfolio of technologies and services from consumer front ends, to streaming and content protection, to user entitlements and payments

 
Here\'s how

  • Provide day to day support for Splunk/New Relic environments and full system life cycle
  • Extensive working experience in creating and implementing dashboards
  • Analyze highly complex business requirements; generate technical specifications to design or redesign complex software components and applications
  • Act as a technical resource expert for modeling, simulation, and analysis efforts
  • Leverage industry best practices to design, test, implement and support the solution
  • Act as the Splunk/New Relic subject matter expert in providing technical leadership in the design, development and support, and other intelligence big data analytics industry initiatives
  • Use your experience to explore a variety of machine learning, statistical analytics, and data mining techniques to improve Corporate Security’s investigative capabilities using technology to support monitoring and digital fraud investigation needs
     

 

Qualifications


What you bring

  • 5 or more years of hands-on experience and extensive working knowledge, training and/or certifications in Splunk Enterprise (installing, configuring, troubleshooting different Splunk components and building clusters; integrating with external services; CI/CD deployment of elements and dashboards)
  • 5 or more years of hands-on experience and extensive working knowledge of New Relic (installing agents, configuring, troubleshooting different New Relic components; configuring API keys, integrating with external services; CI/CD deployment of elements and dashboards)
  • Extensive experience troubleshooting multi-layer frontend/backend systems.
  • Proficiency in Python, SPL language, XML, HTML, CSS, JSON, Excel
  • Solid understanding of SQL scripting for querying databases (MySQL, Postgresql, Cassandra, etc.)
  • 5 or more years of hands-on experience with Linux
  • 3 or more years of hands-on experience with Cloud technologies – GCP, AWS, or Azure
  • Deep knowledge of Kubernetes and underlying technologies
  • Must be self-motivated, energetic, and results-oriented and be committed to adding value to the organization
  • Highly flexible and able to adapt quickly to changing priorities

Great to Have

  • Bachelor\'s degree in a technical field such as computer science, computer engineering or related field required.
  • Deep knowledge of proxying and load balancing technologies such as HAProxy or NGINX
  • Experience in agile development practices including the ability to create CI/CD pipelines from scratch using tools such as: Jenkins, Gitlab and Github
  • Experience building positive relationships and collaborating with a variety of diverse groups and technical teams and able to translate technical concepts into easy-to-understand business language
  • A creative approach to problem solving and the ability to work independently to manage deliverables in an environment with high levels of ambiguity

item.title: Design Specialist I
item.description:
Description

 

Our team and what we’ll accomplish together 

 

As a member of the TELUS National Transport Design Team, you will be working in a dynamic and fast-paced environment responsible for developing and championing engineering standards, providing leadership and technical expertise. You will have the opportunity to work on next generation wireline transport, voice and IP technologies, as well as a variety of wireless technologies critical to the TELUS network.

 

This is an opportunity to join a highly technical, dynamic team during a transformational journey. With the increasing complexity of optical and radio systems and the advent of 5G wireless technology you will have the opportunity not only to influence the introduction of new technologies and leverage your expertise of modern engineering best practices, including automation and machine learning, but also build a core telecommunication network that delivers continued award-winning customer experiences.

 

Our Design team is responsible for the designing all Circuit Vision engineering designs through the National TELUS Core Network from leading edge 100G optical transport to 5G wireless to the automation in a DevOps environment. We are paving the way towards redefining how we build a leading edge telecommunications network through agile methodologies and innovation at the center of our strategy. You will contribute to providing TELUS customers with the most reliable network and the best user experience in every region of the country by efficiently executing on next generation solutions that leverages technological innovation, automation, tools and key partnerships.

What you’ll do

 

  • Plan, prepare and execute the engineering designs and rollout of new wireline and wireless technologies to further evolve the best in class network
  • Develop method of procedures and business continuity plans enabling best in class network deployment standards
  • Collaborate with key partner within TELUS and external partners by leading teams through complex deployments leveraging your technical experience 
  • Drive everyday innovation in our organization through automation or process improvements
  • Apply a ‘Reliability by design’ approach during the new technology planning and rollout steps
  • Proactively engage stakeholders in establishing strong interlock and defined timelines and taking the initiative to resolve project related issues while modeling diplomacy and tact
  • Cultivate internal relationships with project manager, planners, marketing, engineering managers, and construction to ensure smooth workflow and strategic alignment with priorities

 

 

Qualifications

 

What you bring

 

  • Solid understanding of all three levels of transport layers: Layer 0 DWDM/CWDM (both active and passive systems); Layer 1 OTN (both point to point and switched networks); Layer 2 (traditional SONET networks, Ethernet)
  • Ability to evaluate, refine and implement architectural designs based on your advanced knowledge of telecommunications technologies and architectures
  • Experience designing, configuring, testing and evaluating transport and/or wireless networks such as SONET, DWDM/OTN, and Packet Transport
  • University degree in Electronics, Electrical, Computer Science or Telecommunications preferred or equivalent proven industry experience 
  • Ability to manage through ambiguity using Agile program management principles to deliver new capabilities in recognizable iterations that advance a strategic roadmap of improvements and new opportunities
  • Coordinate concurrent projects and/or multiple resources to efficiently allow engineering resources to retire workload

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • 1 to 3 years of related industry experience in wireline or wireless network deployment

item.title: Design Specialist (Cloud RAN automation Technology and Performance)
item.description:
Description

 

Join our team and what we’ll accomplish together

 

The latest Open RAN (Radio Access Network) technology brings not only BBU (baseband unit) cloudifications & virtualization, open interfaces between DU (Distributed Unit) and RU(Radio Unit) , but also introduces and enables ORAN intelligent automation platform namely SMO (Service Management and Orchestration) with RIC (RAN intelligent Controller) which applies automation at scale to simplify the complexity of ORAN networks, as well as improve network performance, enhance customer experience and minimize ORAN operational costs with ORAN analytics and assurance. 

 

TELUS is forming a new Cloud RAN automation platform DevOps team which will oversee the development, operations and evolution of ORAN SMO and RIC architecture and technology. We are embracing disruption, reimagining network services capabilities, and driving growth. We see great value in bringing Cloud, IP/MPLS, data analytics and software development professionals into this team in addition to RAN knowledge to not only develop these platforms but also enhance the systems to enable TELUS ORAN intelligent operations by closely working with TELUS Stakeholders, vendors and ORAN DevOps team.

 

What you’ll do

 

  • Be responsible for ORAN SMO (service management and orchestration) platform design and technology development, drive vendor’s SMO roadmap to align with TELUS’s ORAN automation strategies
  • Be responsible for ORAN RIC (RAN Intelligent Controller) platform design and technology development
  • Create ORAN automation policies & rules, templates & algorithms and workflow services for ORAN full stack automation, including vRAN Bare Metal, xHaul, CaaS, and vDU/vCU services. 
  • Develop O-Cloud (ORAN-Cloud) orchestration and federation solutions including ORAN IMS (Infrastructure Management Services) and DMS (Deployment management Services)
  • Responsible for ORAN Software and Hardware Life Cycle Management solution development and introduction
  • Lead the development of ORAN data processing workflow, as well as data pipelines system design and configurations to ensure data availability and integrity to end users
  • Define TELUS RIC model and algorithm standards for new xApp and rApp onboarding
  • Lead the integration with TELUS overarching remedy’s and systems
  • Drive Open SMO integration with TELUS’s selected vRAN solutions
  • Technology introduction of evolutionary ORAN OAM (FCAPS) via streaming telemetry
  • Lead SMO/RIC platform AI (Artificial Intelligent)/ML (Machine Learning) workflow services design and technology introduction

Qualifications

 

What you bring

 

  • 5+ years of working experience on IP/MPLS and Kubernetes networking, familiar with associated protocols (VxLAN, Calico, CNI, M-LAG, EVPN etc.)
  • Experiences with LTE, 5G NSA (Non-stand alone) and SA (Standalone) RAN (Radio access network) technology
  • Expertise in one or more programming languages and data formats such as Java, Python, GO, XML, YAML, Shell Scripting, JSON, Restful APIs etc. 
  • Experience with managed Kubernetes services such as Google’s Kubernetes Engine (GKE), Amazon’s Elastic Kubernetes Service (EKS), RedHat OpenShift, WindRiver Cloud platform, Robin.io cloud platform
  • Experience on managing and developing cloud-native containerized micro services
  • Experience on Kubernete cloud analytics tools (i.e beats, logstash, elasticsearch, kibana, Kafka and/or Prometheus)
  • Experience on large scale Kubernetes cluster orchestration and federation solutions and tools, familiar with Windriver central cloud and conductor, or Openshift ACM, or Robin MDCAP is a big asset for successful candidate 
  • Creative approach to problem solving and an ability to work independently in an environment with high levels of ambiguity
  • Ability to manage key deliverables as part of an extended project team
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with an ability to translate complex technical concepts to non-technical audiences
  • Proactive, can lead cross-team initiatives
  • A Bachelor or Master Degree in Electrical/computer engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems

 

Great-to-haves 

 

  • Experience in Requirements Engineering, Solution Architecture, Design, Development and Deployment Experience in Underlying infrastructure for Big Data Solutions (Clustered/Distributed Computing, Storage, Data Center Networking) 
  • Familiar with Open-RAN and ETSI specifications and standards
  • Multi- or Hybrid-cloud architectures
  • Experience with Big Data & Analytics tools such as Hadoop MapReduce, Spark, Big Query, DataFlow etc.
  • Experience with AI/ML toolkits such as Tensor Flow, Mllib, H2Oai , Kubeflow etc

ORANJobs  *LI-hybrid *LI-remote

item.title: People Analytics Consultant - People & Culture
item.description:
Description

 

Help business leaders make strategic decisions.

 

Join our team

 

People Analytics (PA) is a small team with big scope. We are collaborative, enthusiastic problem solvers delivering better people and business outcomes through data that is business informed, business relevant, usable, and actionable. PA is responsible for enabling HR and Business leaders with insights to make evidence-based decisions which support the creation and execution of People and Business strategies. The team needs an individual who is creative, technical, curious, and passionate about using data to drive business results. This is a fast paced, highly rewarding role that makes an impact at TELUS through the ability to change the way we look at people data.

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

The Senior People Analytics Consultant will use consulting and analytical skills to deliver people analytics and insights to TELUS’ Business Leaders and HR to drive people strategy and strategic workforce decisions. The job will be a combination of solving strategic problems and servicing day-to-day data requests (80/20 split).

 

Here\'s how

 

  • Gain strong understanding of TELUS’ business and people goals and use analytical skills to make data-driven workforce strategy recommendations to support business objectives
  • Consult with HR and Business leaders to scope client needs, understand the root of the client’s challenge, and translate them to questions that can be approached through analytics
  • Perform exploratory data analysis, generate and test working hypotheses, and uncover trends and relationships
  • Communicate results of analysis to stakeholders at all levels using reports and engaging presentations. Help tell stories with data and make recommendations by interpreting the “so what” and “now what” from analysis
  • Identify, prioritize and implement improved data quality and additional data capture opportunities to enhance analytical capabilities
  • Assist in building analytical acumen among team members in the People & Culture organization

 

 

Qualifications

 

You\'re the missing piece of the puzzle

 

  • High business and analytical acumen with excellent communication skills and demonstrated ability to influence and partner with stakeholders
  • Strong understanding of the HR function and data or a demonstrated ability to quickly acquire functional expertise
  • Ability to draw conclusions using data in order to answer business questions and clearly communicate insights to non-technical stakeholders
  • Comfortable working with large sets of data with ability to merge and analyze data from disparate sources
  • General knowledge of statistical and data analysis tools and methods to conduct or direct analytical work appropriately
  • Advanced Excel skills (lookups, complex array formulas, data modeling, formatting, data visualization)
  • Advanced PowerPoint skills including experience creating compelling presentations that blend data with insights
  • Project orientation and ability to balance multiple projects and priorities
  • Ability to navigate ambiguity while being highly adaptable and flexible to changing demands
  • Learning orientation and desire to stay ahead of the latest developments in the field of HR reporting, analytics and related technology

 

Great-to-haves

 

Preference will be given to candidates with some combination of the following:

 

  • 3+ years of experience working in a consultative capacity using people data to generate critical insights for leaders and decision makers
  • Background in strategy/HR consulting or in I/O psychology
  • Proficiency with SQL, statistical software packages (e.g., R, Python, SAS, SPSS), and data visualization tools
  • Knowledge of various machine learning techniques and key parameters that affect their performance
  • Experience in designing and implementing A/B Testing, measuring and improving processes to enhance Employee experience
  • Experience conducting analysis and creating storyboards in Visier

 

Education

 

  • Bachelor\'s degree in Business, Finance, Math, HR, Social Sciences, or related field or equivalent experience
  • Language – Bilingual English/French an asset

item.title: Senior Strategy Manager
item.description:
Description

 

Join our team and what we’ll accomplish together


This is a dream job for the curious, analytical mind wanting to push the boundaries and challenge the status quo. You will be professionally rewarded by the diversity of problems and data sets, and with your expertise, provide discoveries that will solve complex challenges and opportunities that drive strategic business decisions to delivering optimum business outcomes, including capital deployment plans, and exceptional customers experiences. Additionally, you will develop appropriate data models and frameworks, drawing from various data sources, to support business investments and improved MCE reliability.

 

Our team will formulate and facilitate strategies backed by data. You will use your past experiences to find data, analyze it for trends that support both short term tactics in support of strategies that may take years to achieve.

 

What you’ll do 


Reporting to the Director, Planning & Engineering with the Mission Critical Environments (MCE) team, you are responsible for leading the development and execution of MCE business and transformational programs, driving exemplary client experience and unit cost improvements.

 

You are a dynamic self-starter and thought leader with top-notch people skills and an analytical edge. You will create a consolidated business unit strategy across the MCE planning, operations, and build teams and lead the evolution / execution of multiple, high-priority business unit strategies and programs that will include executive updates via business case and presentations. You are MCE’s lead within the Reliability Leadership Team (RLT) delivering priority and reliability based capital funding requests.

 

You will develop the business unit and MCE capital strategy by:

 

  • Soliciting and consolidate inputs from various stakeholder teams to support the development of the MCE strategic plan, selected business planning roadmaps and issues and opportunities for improvement
  • Establish performance indicators that measure (metrics/KPIs) program success:
    • Develop, maintain and manage appropriate Scorecard (as a measure of success), including working with other relevant resources (x-functional SMEs, ops stakeholders) to define “success” for MCE programs, projects and initiatives
    • Ensure Scorecard Objectives are met – on time, on budget, in scope
    • Provide Executive level reporting
  • Building sound analytics and processes to support the improved understanding of all equipment failure rates and replacement options, including drawing conclusions and recommending proposals resulting from analysis
  • Solving diverse business problems in a data rich environment through data mining, predictive modeling, machine learning, statistics and other analytical techniques
  • Visualizing and reporting data findings creatively in a variety of visual formats that provides insights that will drive strategic business decisions
  • Supporting the development of the annual Strategy Check presentation and support of all yearly planning cycles
  • Lead multiple, large programs and support a high-performance, highly engaged cross-functional team responsible for executing on key cross-functional initiatives
  • Drive program execution against strategic, operational and financial objectives; own and deliver key tenants of MCE financial budget targets
  • Working within an agile/scrum environment
  • Fostering internal as well as external Partner and Client executive relationships

 

 

Qualification

 

What you bring

 

  • University degree (preferably in Engineering or Diploma in Engineering or Electronics plus experience in Statistic modeling)
  • 5 or more years of experience with data analytics experience covering large data volumes and complex data sets from varying sources
  • 5 or more years of experience within Network or IT operations
  • Knowledge or experience in strategic planning, business analysis and/or business systems analysis
  • Project management methodologies, principles and practices
  • Understanding of business drivers, customers and the links to IT strategies & priorities
  • Understanding of performance metrics development & analysis, process improvement or portfolio management
  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to simplify the explanation of complex business challenges
  • Collaboration across all levels of the MCE team and with key stakeholders

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • Six Sigma – green belt

item.title: Senior Market Manager - Journeys & Omnichannel - Koodo
item.description:
Are you passionate about big data and using data science to make better business decisions? Leveraging digital personalization to drive better customer outcomes? Managing strategic projects that focus on core business priorities?


 
Join us!


 
At Koodo, we believe you can eat ice cream in the winter, drink coffee after 4PM, and serve white wine with beef. Because at Koodo we don\'t follow the rules, we make the rules. We\'re small, agile, entrepreneurial, refreshing, challenging and fun. We promise you won\'t find a more exciting place to work. So, join our team of super ninjas and ninjettes and see for yourself why Koodo has been voted the best place to work for 83 years running, by people who work at Koodo.


 
Our team and what we’ll accomplish together


 
As a Senior Market Manager at Koodo, you will be responsible for (i) integrating data science models across all team activities while innovating on new ones, (ii) creating personalized use cases for customers on our Koodo website, (iii) and leading other strategic projects. While primarily sitting in the Churn & Renewal team, all of Koodo Base Management will be your playground, as you help the team reduce churn, manage cost of retention (COR), and drive increased customer step-up revenue. 


 
This role is incredibly cross functional! You will constantly work with the Data Science team to collaborate on models and triggers creation, as well as to innovate on the future of marketing at Koodo. You will liaise with the Koodo and TELUS digital teams to map out customer journeys, as well as manage and prioritize products. You will collaborate with business stakeholders to ensure you are driving the right strategic and financial outcomes. You will wear many hats – some days reviewing model outputs with a data scientist and other days collaborating with your marketing peers to develop the creative strategy for our customer-facing communications – no day is the same, but all days are rewarding!
 

 

What you’ll do
 
 

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams (Digital, Data Science, Call Centre, Store Channels, Marketing Communications, etc.) to develop and maintain the strategy and roadmap for your portfolio, while helping them innovate on theirs
  • Use business analytics and intelligence tools to pull and synthesize insights to create and drive change that improves the conversion rate of Koodo marketing campaigns
  • Use a test and learn approach to continue to improve & evolve Koodo marketing activities
  • Enable technologies that help Koodo become more automated, personalized, contextual, innovative, and anticipatory in the delivery of marketing activities
  • Identify and prioritize key opportunities within the customer journey and path to purchase
  • Provide updates on program goals / outcomes to key business team members and executives, including: business cases, post mortem analyses and building slides / presentations to support your storytelling
  • Act as a key idea generator for journeys and sales conversion at Koodo by maintaining an in-depth understanding on how journeys, new technology and data can have an impact on business priorities and metrics

 

 

What you bring 
 


You are an out of the box thinker who can come up with new and innovative customer journey opportunities, but you are also analytically driven to ensure we are focusing on the right areas. You are a self-starter who moves fast and is eager to learn. You love working with other people, and collaborating to make big business change!
 

  • You have experience leading and developing cross channel marketing campaigns
  • With superior analytical skills, you can organize information and draw insights from data
  • Known for your excellent project management work, having managed and delivered complex projects involving people, process, technology, and change
  • With exceptional communication and collaboration skills, you build solid relationships with stakeholders, and work with teams to consistently deliver on results
  • No challenge is too hard for you – you are willing to roll up your sleeves and work through ambiguous problems and new paths never taken before
  • You are interested in digital technology and how that can change the way businesses engage with their customers
  • 4-6 years of equivalent experience

 

 
Great-to-haves

 

 
Don’t have everything we think are ‘great-to-haves’ below? Don’t let that dissuade you! Attitude, motivation, and a willingness to collaborate are the most important things we are looking for. So if you think you have what it takes, regardless of a fancy university degree or not, please apply!
 

  • University or college degree in Marketing, Business Administration: Honors Business Administration (HBA), Commerce, Master of Business Administration (MBA), Economics, or Engineering
  • 3+ years working experience in Marketing or similar business function.
  • Experience with marketing personalization and personalization enabling technologies (e.g. Adobe Experience Cloud)

item.title: Senior Front End Developer - API Marketplace Portal
item.description:
Join our team


Be a part of a transformational journey with innovative talent and leading-edge technologies. We hope you’ll enjoy being a valued member of Canada’s Top 100 Employer (2022) with a world-leading culture featuring extensive community-giving initiatives, flexible work environment including remote work, and award-winning opportunities for career development.
 
The API Marketplace gives the ability to connect API consumers with API owners, enabling the creation of thousands of applications by TELUS teams and 3rd parties. Being able to support a broad range of applications from customer self-care to health to messaging to emergency response to fleet management to charitable giving and beyond, the API Marketplace plays a foundational role for TELUS to participate in the digital economy.

 
What you\'ll do
 

As a Senior React Developer, you will help drive the software development for our core network infrastructure and services. Your creativity coupled with strong software development, automation, data science, and computer networking skills will allow us to find the most efficient ways of building and maintaining our API gateway platform to a variety of types of services from network capabilities to health services to support existing mobility infrastructure and offer new services.
 
You will exercise your entrepreneurial spirit and creative vision to change the way TELUS leverages technology. Collectively, the passion we have to transform the Network landscape will remain a leading factor in why customers continue to recognize TELUS as the fastest and most reliable network in Canada.

 
Here’s how
 

  • Create new solutions while working as part of our existing Agile Development Team with a good focus on quality, automated testing and reliability
  • Develop quality solutions through adherence to coding standards and test automation.
  • Develop new features and implement design improvements 
  • Participate in creation of technical design documentation: Detail design & architecture documents
  • Participate in operational improvement initiatives, in conjunction with other technology teams in the company

What you bring

 

  • With a Bachelor degree in Computer Science or Engineering
  • Valued for your 5+ years of relevant professional experience as a Senior React Developer with demonstrated experience guiding a team 
  • Skilled in software development/software engineering, process automation using programming/scripting languages
  • Working in collaborative agile development teams, with experience working with CI/CD pipelines and activities.
  • Known for your experience working on cloud computing platforms including AWS & GCP
  • Passionate about API design
  • Committed to building strong relationships with key stakeholders including senior management across the technology and partnering organizations


Great-to-haves
 

  • Java Experience
  • DevOps tools such as Ansible, Jenkins, GitLAB and Splunk


Note:  Can work remotely from any major Canadian city

item.title: Performance Analyst II - Business Intelligence, Commercial
item.description:
Description

 

Join Our Team

 

We are the Business Intelligence team, an integral part of the TELUS Business Marketing organization. We are a dynamic, entrepreneurial, and engaged team driven to rapidly respond and adapt to the changing needs of Canadian business customers including Small, Medium and Large segments. We have mandate to build agile solutions for our stakeholders to drive multiple campaigns to support rapidly changing environment and find new solutions to reach out to our Customers.

 

If you have passion for growth, learning, data, analytics and enjoy fast pace environment, come join our team to make a meaningful impact to support stakeholders across variety of teams to achieve bottom-line success.

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

  • As an Analyst, you will spearhead, multiple programs & campaigns and be hands on to build new solutions. You will work closely with marketing, base management, data science and BI team to build a solution which will have direct impact on marketing sales target and P&L.
  • You will work closely with martech team to implement new technologies and build strong foundation with appropriate solutions which will redefine how TELUS interacts with its customers

  
Here’s how 

 

  • You will develop new analytical solutions to provide timely insights to the business
  • You will assemble multiple data sources across various databases to build foundational campaign data
  • You will build automated solutions to create standardized datasets to increase efficiency for campaign execution.
  • You will implement business intelligence rules, optimize data processes and perform data quality audits
  • Collaborate with business stakeholders, manage relationships and lead data enablement programs
  • Effectively communicate with leadership and stakeholders providing them with regular updates on programs and new solutions
  • Coach and mentor junior team members by promoting creative thinking and fostering an inclusive and supportive work environment 

 

Qualifications

 

You’re the missing piece of the puzzle 

 

  • You have experience spearheading large scale projects, defining business outcomes, managing stakeholder expectations, and partnering with multiple team members
  • You can manage ambiguity and change with a learning and growth mindset
  • You love digging into quantitative and qualitative data
  • You have advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases
  • You have minimum 3+ years of experience in a similar role and/or related education with demonstrated performance

 

Great to haves 

 

  • Prior telecommunications or B2B marketing experience
  • Experience with Python 
  • Campaign experience #LI-REMOTE

item.title: Senior Staff Data Engineer (Remote, Americas)
item.description:
About the role

Our Data Engineering group builds and maintains the platform that delivers accessible data to power decision-making at Shopify for millions of merchants. We’re hiring high-impact developers across teams:

  • The Engine group organizes all merchant and Shopify data into our data lake in highly-optimized formats for fast query processing, and maintaining the security and quality of our datasets.

  • The Analytics group leverages the Engine primitives to build and deliver simple and useful products that power scalable transformation of data at Shopify in batch, streaming, or for machine learning. This group is focused on making it really simple for our users to answer three questions: What happened in the past? What is happening now? And, what will happen in the future?  

  • The Data Experiences group builds end-user experiences for experimentation, data discovery, and business intelligence reporting.

  • The Reliability group operates the data platform in a consistent and reliable manner. They build tools for other teams on Data Platform to leverage and encourage consistency as they champion reliability across the platform.

Qualifications

  • An experienced technical leader with a proven track record of delivering impactful results.

  • Technical engineering background in one or more areas in the next section.

  • Experience with technical mentoring, coaching, and improving the technical output of the people around you.

  • Exceptional communication skills and ability to translate technical concepts into easy to understand language for our stakeholders. 

  • Excitement for working with a remote team; you value collaborating on problems, asking questions, delivering feedback, and supporting others in their goals whether they are in your vicinity or entire cities apart.

A Sr. Staff Data Engineer would typically have 8-12years of experience in one or more of the following areas:

  • Experience with the internals of a distributed compute engine (Spark, Presto, DBT, or Flink/Beam)

  • Experience in query optimization, resource allocation and management, and data lake performance (Presto, SQL)

  • Experience with cloud infrastructure (Google Cloud, Kubernetes, Terraform)
    Experience with security products and methods (Apache Ranger, Apache Knox, OAuth, IAM, Kerberos)

  • Experience deploying and scaling ML solutions using open-source frameworks (MLFlow, TFX, H2O, etc.)

  • Experience building full-stack applications (Ruby/Rails, React, TypeScript)

  • Background and practical experience in statistics and/or computational mathematics (Bayesian and Frequentist approaches, NumPy, PyMC3, etc.)

  • Modern Big-Data storage technologies (Iceberg, Hudi, Delta)

We know that looking for a new role can be both exciting and time-consuming, and we truly appreciate your effort. Brad is an actual real live person (👋🏻) and is looking forward to learning more about you through your application. And remember, we want to know what you\'re really interested in building and why you want to build it at Shopify, so please give us as much detail on this as you\'d like in the answers on the next page. 👍 📖

As there are multiple positions, this posting will remain live until all positions have been filled. Successful candidates can expect to hear back from us within 1-3 weeks of application.
 

Our belief is that a strong commitment to diversity & inclusion enables us to truly make commerce better for everyone. We encourage applications from Indigenous peoples, racialized people, people with disabilities, people from gender and sexually diverse communities, and/or people with intersectional identities. Please take a look at our Sustainability Reports to learn more about Shopify’s commitments to our communities, and our planet.

At Shopify, we understand that experience comes in many forms. We’re dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team - so if your experience is this close to what we’re looking for, please consider applying.

Our belief is that a strong commitment to diversity & inclusion enables us to truly make commerce better for everyone. We encourage applications from Indigenous peoples, racialized people, people with disabilities, people from gender and sexually diverse communities, and/or people with intersectional identities. Please take a look at our Sustainability Reports to learn more about Shopify’s commitments to our communities, and our planet.

At Shopify, we understand that experience comes in many forms. We’re dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team - so if your experience is this close to what we’re looking for, please consider applying.

How we hire

At Shopify, we put a lot of care and time into who we hire. We believe that in order to build the best products, we need to build high impact teams. Our recruitment process centres around what we call the Life Story interview, a conversational-style interview where we get to learn more about you.
Learn more about our hiring process

item.title: Lead (Staff) Data Scientist (Remote, Canada)
item.description:
About the role

Data is a crucial part of Shopify’s mission to make commerce better for everyone. We organize and interpret petabytes of data to provide solutions for our merchants and stakeholders across the organization. From pipelines and schema design to machine learning products and decision support, data science at Shopify is a diverse role with many opportunities to positively impact our success. 

Our Staff (i.e Lead) Data Scientists focus on pushing products and the business forward, with a focus on solving important problems rather than specific tools. We are looking for talented data scientists to help us better understand our merchants and buyers so we can help them on their journey.

Qualifications

  • 7-10 years of commercial experience in a data science role solving high impact business problems
  • You have well built technical experience that inspires individual contributors  creativity and innovation. 
  • You have experience with product leadership and technical decision making.
  • You have been working closely with various levels of business stakeholders, from c-suite and down.
  • You can jump into the code on a deep level, but are also able to contribute to long term initiatives by mentoring your team.
  • Multiple work streams excites you, you are able to use ambiguity as an opportunity for high level thinking.
  • Experience creating data product strategies, data products, iterating after launch, and trying again.
  • Extensive experience using Python including a strong grasp of object oriented programming (OOP) fundamentals

What would be great if you have:

  • Previous experience using Spark.
  • Experience with statistical methods like regression, GLMs or experiment design and analysis.
  • Exposure to Tableau, QlikView, Mode, Matplotlib, or similar data visualization tools.

 

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

If you’re interested in helping us shape the future of commerce at Shopify, click the “Apply Now” button to submit your application. Please submit a resume and cover letter with your application. Make sure to tell us how you think you can make an impact at Shopify, and what drew you to the role. 

As there are multiple positions, this posting will remain live until all positions have been filled. Successful candidates can expect to hear back from us within 2 weeks of application.

#LI-REMOTE

Our belief is that a strong commitment to diversity & inclusion enables us to truly make commerce better for everyone.
