item.title: Senior Data Scientist (Remote, Canada)
item.description:
About the role

Data is a crucial part of Shopify’s mission to make commerce better for everyone. We organize and interpret petabytes of data to provide solutions for our merchants and stakeholders across the organization. From pipelines and schema design to machine learning products and decision support, data science at Shopify is a diverse role with many opportunities to positively impact our success. 

Our Data Scientists focus on pushing products and the business forward, with a focus on solving important problems rather than specific tools. We are looking for talented data scientists to help us better understand our merchants and buyers so we can help them on their journey.

Responsibilities: 

  • Proactively identify and champion projects that solve complex problems across multiple domains
  • Partner closely with product, engineering and other business leaders to influence product and program decisions with data
  • Apply specialized skills and fundamental data science methods (e.g. regression, survival analysis, segmentation, experimentation, and machine learning when needed) to inform improvements to our business
  • Design and implement end-to-end data pipelines: work closely with stakeholders to build instrumentation and define dimensional models, tables or schemas  that support business processes
  • Build actionable KPIs, production-quality dashboards, informative deep dives, and scalable data products
  • Influence leadership to drive more data-informed decisions
  • Define and advance best practices within data science and product teams

Qualifications

  • 4-6 years of commercial experience as a Data Scientist ​​​​​​solving high impact business problems
  • Extensive experience with Python and software engineering fundamentals
  • Experience with applied statistics and quantitative modelling (e.g. regression, survival analysis, segmentation, experimentation, and machine learning when needed)
  • Demonstrated ability to translate analytical insights into clear recommendations and effectively communicate them to technical and non-technical stakeholders
  • Curiosity about the problem domain and an analytical approach
  • Strong sense of ownership and growth mindset

Experience with one or more:

  • Deep understanding of advanced SQL techniques
  • Expertise with statistical techniques and their applications in business
  • Masterful data storytelling and strategic thinking
  • Deep understanding of dimensional modelling and scaling ETL pipelines
  • Experience launching productionized machine learning models at scale
  • Extensive domain experience in e-commerce, marketing or SaaS

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

item.title: Mobile Robotics Autonomy Researcher Intern/Co-op
item.description:
Description

Position: Mobile Robotics Autonomy Researcher Intern/Co-op
Location: Kitchener, Ontario
Student Level: Senior/Graduate Studies
Area of Study: Mechatronics/System Design/Computer Science/Nanotech/Software
Engineering

About Us:
Clearpath provides autonomous robots and support services to over 1,000 of the world’s
most innovative organizations. Hardware, software, and services are delivered through the
company’s research and industrial divisions: Clearpath Robotics and OTTO Motors.
We employ a diverse and highly talented team who live and breathe robotics. We believe
that work must have a high “cool” factor and every day should bring new knowledge. We
need more passionate people on our team who are willing and able to push the boundaries
of robotics into focused and practical applications.
We are automating the world and we need your help. Got what it takes?

About the Job:
Our OTTO Motors industrial division has recently announced that we will be making our
state of the art autonomy software available for use by other companies. We have a
substantial team working with strategic partners already, but want to make it available to as
many users as possible as fast as possible. You will take the lead in an internal software
prototyping effort to develop configurations on a variety of existing robot platforms in
advance of our general release.

About You:
You want the software and systems you work on to impact the physical world directly, and
your debugging skills are just as refined as your programming skills. Real world applications
are more important to you than theory. You’re interested in working on products which serve
some of the world’s most critical industries. You are suspicious of any system which works
right the first time.

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Generating and testing platform and autonomy configurations
  • Writing and executing physical and virtual robot tests
  • Developing example robot applications
  • Documenting development and debugging activities
Required Experience & Skills:
  • Past software development experience using Python, C++, ROS, and git
  • Proficiency with Linux (especially Ubuntu)
  • Have built or have simulated at least one autonomous robot before
  • Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and manage deadlines independently
Bonus Experience & Skills:
  • Familiarity with Gazebo and Lua
  • Capable of basic electromechancial integration and troubleshooting
  • Familiar with executing and analyzing automated tests
  • Experience with embedded hardware, particularly if it weighs more than you do, moves
    faster than you do, and thinks that “Terminator” is an instructional video
Clearpath is committed to supporting a culture of diversity and accessibility across the
organization. We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin,
ancestry, disability, marital status, age, sex, veteran status or sexual orientation. If you
require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview
process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Perception Autonomy Developer Co-op
item.description:
Description

Position:  Perception Autonomy Developer Co-op
Location:  Kitchener, Ontario            
Study Level: Senior 
Area of study: Computer Science/ Software Engineering, or similar  

About Clearpath Robotics Inc.

Clearpath Robotics Inc. develops the future of robotics technology through development and sale of industry-leading self-driving technology, products, and services to over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands. Proprietary hardware, software, and services are delivered through the company’s research products and industrial divisions: Clearpath Robotics and OTTO™ Motors. Clearpath Robotics Inc. is an award-winning company with recent awards including Robotics Business Review Top 50 Robotics Company, Edison Award for Innovation, Business Insider Top 40 under 40, and Canada’s Top 100 Employers.

About OTTO™ Motors

OTTO™ Motors is making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit https://ottomotors.com

About the Job

Clearpath\'s OTTO Motors robots lead the industry in self-driving materials handling, and you can help us push robotics to the next level of intelligence and performance. This means continually learning, inventing, and implementing new algorithms, all with an emphasis on robust and reliable best practice programming. We\'re looking for people excited to develop the next generation of perception algorithms to tackle the toughest challenges in localization and mapping, machine learning, computer vision and more.

The perception team’s primary responsibility is the development of the core robotics software responsible for environmental perception and understanding on all of our vehicles. As a Perception Autonomy Developer you will work on the testing and development of core robotics software responsible for environmental perception and understanding on all our vehicles. You will be responsible for evaluating state-of-the-art ideas from academia and industry, and taking these ideas out of the lab and into the real world, identifying opportunities to improve, and developing high-performance software to run in real time on the robots.

Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Create robust innovative solutions to the problems of robotic perception
  • Development of custom SLAM, computer vision, machine learning, target tracking and perception algorithms
  • Evaluation of new perception algorithms and sensing technology
  • Design and implement new perception systems and algorithms
  • Develop integration and unit tests for perception features
  • Supporting deployment and testing of robotic systems

Additional tasks may include:

  • Collaboration with internal teams including the Simulation Team and Navigation Team
  • Triage and support of live industrial systems in the field

Required Skills:

  • Practical and theoretical knowledge in at least one or more areas of: state estimation, computer vision, SLAM, machine learning, target detection and tracking, robotic perception
  • Strong software development skills in modern C++
  • Proficiency with Linux
  • Excellent teamwork/communication skills
  • Ability to independently develop high quality software solutions

Bonus points for:

  • Hands-on experience with real autonomous systems
  • Experience writing efficient, high performance code
  • ROS, TensorFlow, Gazebo, and PCL experience
  • Familiarity with graph optimization techniques and libraries
  • Experience with git or other DVCS systems and other software development processes
  • Understanding of sensor error modeling, particularly laser rangefinders and vision systems

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Software Developer Co-op (Fleet Core Team)
item.description:
Description

Position at Clearpath Inc.

Position: Software Developer Co-op (Fleet Core Team)
Location: Kitchener, Ontario
Student Level: Intermediate
Education: Computer Science/Software Engineering

About OTTO™ Motors

OTTO™ Motors is making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit https://ottomotors.com

About the Job

The OTTO Motors division of Clearpath is looking for a Software Developer Co-op to join the Fleet Core team.

The Fleet Core team is responsible for the design, integration, and evolution of Clearpath\'s fleet management and related system software. Your goal is to assist the team in building a system of robust and efficient software that can be deployed or upgraded by hundreds of integrator partners across the globe with the minimum of fuss.

You will be working with the Fleet Core team to migrate its WebSocket software to a new architecture. This work will involve building upon the currently migrated infrastructure, implementing and testing at scale the newly migrated software.

About You

You\'re excited about the role that robots will play in the future, and intrigued by the challenge of joining a fast-paced growing company. You are driven, view co-op as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems

Responsibilities include:

  • Develop and migrate software for the OTTO Fleet Manager Websocket server’s new architecture
  • Test plan development and implementation, for functionality and stability at scale
  • Preparation and presentation of design documentation
  • Develop and show demonstration of work to the team
  • Contribute to design and code reviews

Skills/Requirements:

  • Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and manage deadlines
  • Enjoy being challenged and getting engaged with software development projects
  • Practical software development skills
  • Team player, good communicator
  • Familiarity with developing software in Linux
  • Proficiency in Python
  • Good understanding of object-oriented design principles

Bonus points for:

  • Experience with frameworks / platforms utilizing SQL Databases (Django, Flask, etc.)
  • Experience with distributed software systems
  • Experience with HTTP REST and WebSocket APIs
  • Experience writing unit tests
  • Experience using version control (Git, CVS, etc.)
  • Familiarity with Continuous Integration process
  • Familiarity with network analysis / pcap based tools
  • ROS software development experience
  • Any software projects developed by you and can be viewed on Github, Bitbucket, etc.

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

Education:     Graduate Degree in Related Field

OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

Clearpath\'s OTTO Motors robots lead the industry in self-driving materials handling, and you can help us push robotics to the next level of intelligence and performance. This means continually learning, inventing, and implementing new algorithms for navigation, collaboration, and control - all with an emphasis on robust and reliable best practice programming. item.title: Certifications and Compliance Lead
item.description:
Description

Location: Kitchener, Ontario              

Experience: 3 to 5 years experience in managing product compliance and certifications. 5+ years of relevant industry experience.

Education: Bachelor’s degree in a related technical field

Division: OTTO Motors  

About Us:

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)
OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job:

You will be working with multiple engineering teams and external partners to plan and execute the certification efforts for multiple industrial products. To complete this work you will:

  • Provide regular guidance to product/engineering teams on both the content of applicable national/international standards and underlying reasons for same.
  • Ensure that technical documentation is complete.
  • Compile and lodge technical reports with the relevant authorities.
  • Summarise relevant test data.
  • Liaise with NRTLs (Nationally Recognised Testing Laboratories) to acquire and maintain certification markings.
  • File declarations of conformity with government bodies where applicable.
  • Participate in product design reviews to ensure design trajectory will meet regulatory compliance requirements.
  • Manage critical parts lists that impact safety and EMC compliance.
  • Perform risk assessments and guiding other team members on risk assessment strategy.
  • Represent company on various standards committees relevant to product offerings

About You:

You are a self-starter and capable of creating your own role in collaboration with other teams. You are able to take a goal and design the processes and tasks necessary in collaboration with other groups and teams in order to make it happen. You are good at planning and documenting projects and know how to organize technical documentation.

Requirements:

  • Experience with machinery risk assessment activities (ISO 12100, 13849 or similar)
  • Experience liaising with recognized testing agencies for electrical safety certification markings (eg., CSA, TUV, UL)
  • Experience with CE requirements and documentation (e.g., Machinery Directive, Technical File, Declarations of Conformity, Material compliance, WEEE)
  • Experience in applying the standards ISO 13849, Safety of Machinery, or ANSI B11.0
  • Experience with product lifecycle norms.
  • A multidisciplinary technical background.

Bonus Points:

  • Valid and current Ontario P. Eng.
  • Experience in designing to comply with the European Machinery Directive 2006/42/EC
  • Experience in applying ISO EN 3691-4 / ANSI R15.08
  • Experience in applying ISO EN 1525 / ANSI B56.5
  • Experience in applying IEC 61508/IEC 62061
  • Experience in applying CSA Z434 (ISO 10218) / CSA Z432
  • Experience with IEC 60204, UL 508A / UL 583 / UL 3100, NFPA 79, NEMA and other relevant electronics standards.
  • Experience with the software V-model or other similar verification and validation methodologies
  • Experience with SISTEMA or a similar tool for MTTFd calculation.

Additionally you will help create the templates and structures necessary for documentation and coordinate the test and certification work with NRTLs. You may participate on standards committees.

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: OS Robotics - Software Developer
item.description:
Description

Position: OS Robotics - Software Developer

Location: Kitchener, Ontario

Experience: 3+ years

Education: Graduate degree in engineering/CS or a related field

Division: OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)
OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About Our Opportunity

At OTTO Motors (division of Clearpath Robotics, Inc), we design flexible and intelligent autonomous mobile robots for industry, with the ultimate goal of automating the world\'s dullest, dirtiest, and deadliest jobs. 

You will be joining the OS (Operating Systems) team, who are responsible for bridging the gap between the mechanical machine, the autonomy stack and the fleet manager. In this team, you will have the opportunity to experience a very broad software stack ranging from kernel device drivers, application layer components, networking components and fleet management functionality. Your code will ultimately run on the robots and control mission-critical functionality such as battery management, sensor drivers or motor command output.

As a Software Developer, you will: 

  • Design and implement custom software, ranging from low-level robot control code to fleet communication and application development ( C++, python, ROS, ROS2 )
  • Architecture development, in conjunction with our Autonomy and Fleet management teams
  • Participating in team-wide coding and architecture reviews
  • Collaborate with other teams including perception and navigation, fleet management and application UI
  • Triage and support of live industrial systems in our test facilities

You come ready with:

  • 3+ years of experience working on C++ projects
  • Graduate degree in engineering/CS or a related field, with applicable background
  • Strong software development skills (C++ and Python)
  • Proficiency with Linux (Debian based distributions)
  • Working knowledge of the Git version control system
  • Used UnitTesting frameworks such as GTest/GMock or other
  • Excellent teamwork and communication skills
  • Ability to develop software development plans, including timelines and test procedures
  • Able to work in Canada

What’s in it for you:

  • Work life balance - vacation, flexible long weekends, half-day birthdays and wellness days
  • Flexibility in when you work, core hours are 10am-3pm EST
  • Competitive salary and career growth opportunities
  • Comprehensive benefits for you and your family to support your health and wellness
  • Additional perks to get you set up at home/work
  • Opportunity to make a difference with the world’s deadliest, dirtiest and dangerous jobs
  • Amazing co-workers to laugh and have fun 
  • Engineering run quarterly Hack Days to pursue interests, passion projects, and experiments
  • Enjoy designing the future of robotics!

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility. We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Senior GPU/CUDA Expert
item.description:
Description

Position: Senior GPU/CUDA Expert

Location: Hybrid work, based in Kitchener-Waterloo

Experience: 5+ years

Education: Bachelor\'s degree in engineering/CS or a related field

Division: OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)
OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About Our Opportunity

At OTTO Motors (division of Clearpath Robotics, Inc), we design flexible and intelligent autonomous mobile robots for industry, with the ultimate goal of automating the world\'s dullest, dirtiest, and deadliest jobs. 

We’re looking for an experienced GPU/CUDA Developer who will be in charge of building and maintaining high performance algorithm software for self-driving vehicles including 3D sensor pipelines, image processing, and various complex optimization problems.

As a successful candidate, you will be joining the OS (Operating Systems) team, responsible for the glue software connecting hardware sensors with the perception and navigation layer of OTTO Motors state-of-the-art autonomy stack. In this team, you will have the opportunity to experience a very broad software stack ranging from kernel device drivers, application layer components, networking components and fleet management functionality. Your code and contributions will ultimately run on the robots, supporting leading edge technology in large fleets of automation in factories, already deployed and growing.

 

As a GPU/CUDA Expert, you will: 

  • Develop implementations of core autonomy algorithms on GPU-accelerated systems using CUDA
  • Investigate and drive improvements in CPU bounded algorithms and provide a GPU-accelerated solution when applicable
  • Evaluate and analyze performance of GPU-accelerated systems and drive for performance improvement
  • Track cutting-edge GPU acceleration technologies in industry
  • Explore and define roadmaps of CPU and GPU architectures for OTTO robots
  • Participate in cross-team coding and architecture reviews with a keen eye on performance challenges

You come ready with:

  • Strong mathematics skills, particularly related to the areas of 3D point cloud processing, computer vision, multivariate optimization and other domains required for self-driving vehicles
  • Experience in GPU programming (Nvidia GPUs / CUDA)
  • Strong software development skills in modern C++
  • In depth knowledge of computer architectures and parallel programming
  • Linux system diagnostics, LTTng, VTune, Valgrind or similar toolchain experience.
  • Moderate to strong Linux platform experience (more than CLI, bordering on kernel compilation)
  • Working knowledge of the Git version control system
  • Excellent teamwork and communication skills
  • Able to work in Canada

What’s in it for you:

  • Work life balance - vacation, flexible long weekends, half-day birthdays and wellness days
  • Flexibility in when you work, core hours are 10am-3pm EST
  • Competitive salary and career growth opportunities
  • Comprehensive benefits for you and your family to support your health and wellness
  • Additional perks to get you set up at home/work
  • Opportunity to make a difference with the world’s deadliest, dirtiest and dangerous jobs
  • Amazing co-workers to laugh and have fun 
  • Engineering run Hack Days to pursue interests, passion projects, and experiments
  • The future of robotics!

 

At OTTO Motors, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility. We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

Description

Position: Software Deployment Engineer (Fleet Manager)

Location: Kitchener, Ontario             

Experience: 3+ Years of relevant related experience

Education: Post-Secondary degree or diploma in Computer Systems Technology or related field

Division: OTTO Motors


About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)
OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Opportunity

We are looking for a Software Deployment Engineer who will be responsible for the design, integration, and evolution of Clearpath\'s Fleet Manager deployment and configuration process. You will research and evaluate new technologies for the software deployment strategy, as well as working to evolve best practices. You will be working closely with other members of the development team as well as many other groups within OTTO Motors, championing both vision and strategy for the deployment of the Fleet Manager

Who You Are:

As a Software Deployment Engineer you know the ins and outs of infrastructure technologies applied to software deployment and strive to automate whatever you can along the way. You want ownership of the software and processes you create and maintain. You keep on top of the latest technologies and have an unnatural love for destroying things just to see how they work. You’re also an excellent communicator and team player, and you’ve got a real knack for coming up with solutions that make and keep people happy.

You come ready with:

  • 3+ years of experience within IT or Software development related role(s)
  • Proficiency with Linux
  • Strong Bash or other shell scripting language experience
  • Moderate to strong Debian based Linux skills - package management and configuration
  • Container deployment experience (Docker, Kubernetes, Helm)
  • Knowledge of configuration management technologies (Ansible, Chef, Puppet, etc.)
  • SCM experience (git, Gitlab, Github, Bitbucket, SVN, etc.)
  • Experience with software testing, and Continuous Integration process and CI systems (Jenkins, Gitlab CI, etc.)
  • Able to work in Canada

Bonus points for:

  • Python development experience
  • Experience with ticket and content management systems (JIRA, Confluence, etc.) 
  • Experience with web frameworks and SQL Databases (Django, Flask, etc.)
  • Experience working in a collaborative environment, interfacing with other team members regularly, sharing knowledge via diagrams, discussion, and examples
  • Ability to independently develop software development plans, including timelines and test procedures

What’s In It For You?

  • Work-life balance - vacation, flexible long weekends, half-day birthdays and wellness days
  • Flexibility in when you work, core hours are 10am-3pm EST
  • Competitive salary and career growth opportunities
  • Comprehensive benefits for you and your family to support your health and wellness
  • Additional perks to get you set up at home/work
  • Opportunity to make a difference with the world’s deadliest, dirtiest and dangerous jobs
  • Amazing co-workers to laugh and have fun
  • Engineering run quarterly Hack Days to pursue interests, passion projects, and experiments
  • Enjoy designing the future of robotics!

About Clearpath Robotics Inc.
Clearpath Robotics Inc. develops the future of robotics technology through development of self-driving technology, products, and services to over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands. item.title: Controller
item.description:
Description

Position:        Controller
Location:       Kitchener, Ontario            
Experience:   10+ Years of relevant experience
Education:     University degree in a related field and CPA designation 

About Clearpath Robotics Inc.
Clearpath Robotics Inc. (“Clearpath”) develops the future of robotics technology through industry-leading self-driving technology, products, and services to over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands. Proprietary hardware, software, and services are delivered through the company’s research and industrial divisions: Clearpath Robotics and OTTO™ Motors. Clearpath is an award-winning company - including Robotics Business Review Top 50 Robotics Company, Edison Award for Innovation, Business Insider Top 40 under 40, and Canada’s Top 100 Employers. 

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)
OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Finance Team
We are growing again and looking to add to our Team!  If you are aspiring to be a Controller who thrives in a fast-paced environment - we would like to help you grow in your career.  
Our track record for promoting from within and supporting individuals to reach their goals is part of what we do.  Reporting to the Director, Finance, and collaborating with the Finance and Operational Teams will provide you the opportunity to be an integral part of our business and the support to be an effective leader.   
  
About the Job - Primary Objectives
The Controller is responsible to support building the financial strength of the company and the integrity of the financial systems. accounts and reporting.  In addition, the position is responsible to:
  • Facilitate financial support of strategic transactions through strong internal controls and information systems, accurate and timely reporting under ASPE, efficient financial operations, treasury functions, clean audits, and a resilient Finance Team
  • Working collaboratively with the CFO, Director, Finance, and Operations Teams to implement digitization initiatives expanding the capacity and capabilities of the company and its divisions.  
  • Strengthen the financial well-being of the Company by documenting systems that capture and build upon knowledge and follow good governance practices
  • Direct and oversee the daily activities of the Accounting and Finance Group
  • Support risk mitigation strategies with the CFO and Commercial Contracts Manager
Strategy
  • Provide recommendations to enhance financial performance
  • Share analysis and recommendations  
  • Contribute and develop Finance Team Strategies
Recording and Reporting
  • Manage the Finance Team\'s monthly reconciliations, reporting, and insights
  • Execute, track and report the Company’s stock option and employee benefit plans.
  • Prepare internal management accounting reports, external financial statements and reports as well as financial and other information for income tax reporting purposes.
  • Report to the CFO and Director, Finance - the Company’s compliance with government regulations & corporation bylaws. 
Audit & Tax
  • Comply with internal controls, ASPE and applicable federal, provincial, and local regulatory laws and rules for financial and tax reporting are in place
  • Coordinate the periodic and year-end audit with the Finance Team and auditors.
  • Coordinate the Company’s tax strategies, tax working papers, and preparation of income tax returns and SR&ED claims 
Financial Planning
  • Contribute to Management Discussion and Analysis for Executive Team, Investors, and Managers with analysis
  • Optimize working capital through systems and transactions completed in a timely manner 
Other 
  • Coach and develop Finance Team to build capacity and capabilities
  • Respond to risk assessments and implement recommendations required 
  • Respond to financing partners\' requests for information and reporting
  • Support business grant and loan opportunities - collate grant application information and prepare periodic reports. 
Key Requirements
  • 10+ years in progressively responsible financial leadership roles, preferably in the high-tech or manufacturing industry.
  • BA in Accounting or Finance, CGA, CMA, or CPA designation required.
  • Strong interpersonal skills, and ability to communicate and manage well at all levels of the organization.
  • Strong problem-solving and creative skills and the ability to exercise sound judgment and make decisions based on accurate and timely analyses. 
  • High level of integrity and dependability with a strong sense of urgency and results orientation.
  • High level of proficiency with ERP systems and Microsoft Office Word and Excel.
At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

In addition to working closely with the Director, Finance and CFO to implement Finance and Operational initiatives, the Financial Analyst / Business Analyst will be responsible to support the integration and optimization of Salesforce and EPICOR ERP System and Bamboo HR, and other leading edge software - this may include work with IT, Consultants and other software subject matter experts within the company.


You will have plenty of opportunities to collaborate with, and provide business decision support.  In addition, the position is responsible to:

  • Facilitate financial support of strategic projects 
  • Working collaboratively with the CFO, Director, Finance and Controller to implement digitization initiatives expanding the capacity and capabilities of the company, its divisions and the Finance Team
  • Strengthen the financial well-being of the Company by documenting systems that capture and build upon knowledge and follow good governance practices
  • Support risk mitigation strategies with the CFO and Commercial Contracts Manager

  • Share analysis and recommendations to improve financial performance of the company 

Accounting and Reporting

  • Reconcile assigned general ledger accounts monthly and provide associated reporting and insights
  • Assist with the tracking and reporting of the Company’s employee stock option plan.
  • Assist with preparation of internal management accounting reports, external financial statements and reports as well as financial and other information for income tax reporting purposes.

Other Assignments 

  • Coach and develop Operational Teams to build ERP and system and financial knowledge and capabilities
  • Automate financing partners requests for information and reporting
  • Build virtual data rooms to support business grant and loan opportunities - collate grant application information and prepare periodic reports.
  • Implement system internal controls recommendations, ASPE compliance and applicable federal, provincial and local regulatory laws and rules
  • Contribute to the periodic and year end audits with the Finance Team and auditors.
  • Validate timecard data capture to support SR&ED claims 

 

Key Requirements

  • 5+ years experience in public accounting or high technology or manufacturing industry
  • BA in Accounting or Finance, CGA, CMA or CPA designation an asset
  • Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate and manage well at all levels of the organization
  • Strong problem solving and creative skills and the ability to exercise sound judgment and make decisions based on accurate and timely analyses. 
  • High level of integrity and dependability with a strong sense of urgency and results-orientation.
  • High level of proficiency with software including ERP systems, Google Suite and Microsoft Office Word and Excel
  • Self motivated, highly organized and ability to work independently
  • Attention to detail but can see the big picture

  • Contribute to Management Discussion and Analysis for Executive Team, Investors and Managers with analysis
  • Contribute to internal controls recommendations, ASPE compliance and applicable federal, provincial and local regulatory laws and rules
  • Contribute to the periodic and year end audits with the Finance Team and auditors.
  • Assist with the Company’s tax working papers and preparation of income tax returns and SR&ED claims

Key Requirements
  • 3+ years experience in public accounting or high technology or manufacturing industry
  • BA in Accounting or Finance, CGA, CMA or CPA designation an asset
  • Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate and manage well at all levels of the organization
  • Strong problem solving and creative skills and the ability to exercise sound judgment and make decisions based on accurate and timely analyses.
  • High level of integrity and dependability with a strong sense of urgency and results-orientation.
  • High level of proficiency with ERP systems and Microsoft Office Word and Excel.
  • Self motivated, highly organized and ability to work independently
  • Attention to detail but can see the big picture

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility. We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863 or email at resourcefulhumans@clearpathrobotics.com

item.title: Robot Builder
item.description:
Description

About Clearpath Robotics Inc.

Clearpath Robotics Inc. develops the future of robotics technology through development and sale of industry-leading self-driving technology, products, and services to over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands. Proprietary hardware, software, and services are delivered through the company’s research and industrial divisions: Clearpath Robotics and OTTO™ Motors. Clearpath Robotics Inc. is an award-winning company with recent awards including Robotics Business Review Top 50 Robotics Company, Edison Award for Innovation, Business Insider Top 40 under 40, and Canada’s Top 100 Employers.

About the Job:

We are currently selling more robots than we can build! We require a handy individual to take charge of assembling a variety of different platforms and ensuring that we perpetually strive for a higher level of quality. We need a Robot Builder to take responsibility in assembling our core products along with their accessories.

You will contribute to a team dedicated to seeing a robotic platform from start to finish. Additionally, when you are not wrenchin’ down screws, you will be tasked with maintaining the organization and cleanliness of the production area.

This position requires the worker to be on site for the full daily shift. There is no opportunity to work from home. 

Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Electromechanical Assembly of robotic platforms 
    • Use of hand tools
    • Use of hoisting equipment
    • Cable installation and wire routing
  • Rotating throughout different assembly stations to achieve cross-training among team members
  • Ensuring your workspace follows 5S guidelines
  • Using a computer for work instructions via VKS system
  • Production area maintenance
  • Production equipment maintenance
  • Other duties as assigned

About You:

You want to work for a small company that thinks big and dreams huge.  You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied doing a job less than 100%.  You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work.  You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems.  

Required Skills:

  • Experience working on manual product assembly
  • Wiring or cable installation experience preferred
  • Hands-on experience with common tools, eg, screwdriver, hammer, and electric drills.
  • Practical knowledge of Microsoft Office Excel and GSuite
  • Able to work the Day shift Hours 7am - 3pm Monday to Friday
  • Positive and professional attitude with safety mindset
  • Proven ability to work independently
  • Experience working with ERP systems is an asset.
  • Ability to follow written assembly work instructions in English
  • Comfortable with abrupt changes to project deadlines.
  • Ability to lift up to 50 lbs comfortably 

Bonus points for:

  • Hobbies that involve working with power tools, woodworking for instance
  • Hobbies that involve assembly with hand tools, car maintenance for instance
  • Lean manufacturing experience
  • Continuous Improvement Process
  • 5S methodology
  • Previously being part of a Health & Safety Committee

What’s in it for you:

  • Work life balance - vacation, flexible long weekends, half-day birthdays and wellness days
  • Competitive salary and career growth opportunities
  • Comprehensive benefits for you and your family to support your health and wellness
  • Corporate discounts and Group Insurance (home and auto)
  • Free snacks to keep you energized during the shift!
  • Cool company events such as BBQs and other celebrations including occasional food trucks at the facilities
  • Growth opportunities 
  • Friendly and fun co-workers!

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility. We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Content Marketing Coordinator
item.description:
Description

About OTTO™ Motors

OTTO™ Motors is making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Opportunity:

OTTO Motors is looking for a Content Marketing Coordinator to join our mighty team. In this role, you’ll help manage OTTO Motors’ content calendar and develop assets at every stage of the buyer journey from thought leadership at TOFU all the way down to technical pieces in BOFU that are intended to educate late-stage prospects, partners and customers. Your main goal will be to support a content plan that will engage and keep prospects converting throughout the funnel.

Reporting to the Manager, Demand Generation and working closely with leaders across the organization, especially the Director of Product Marketing, you’ll play a key role in driving short and long-form content at a time when content is at the center of our new verticalization strategy.

Responsibilities:

  •  Effectively help level up OTTO Motors’ content calendar (blogs, eBooks, one pagers, guides, emails, newsletters, presentations, video scripts and photography).
  • Support OTTO Motors’ content pillars; you should have command of market and industry trends, enjoy being creative and understand how to develop content for all stages of the funnel: top, middle, and bottom.
  • Leverage internal experts on the Product, Engineering and Services teams as well as external subject matter experts, influencers, advisors, and customers to create technical content that is engaging, informative, and useful.
  • Repurpose content in multiple formats, including webpages, blogs, and videos in partnership with other members of the marketing team.
  • Ensure all content aligns with the FY23 content calendar and content pillars
  • Liaise with external vendors to complete content pieces (graphic designers, content vendors)

What You Bring to the Role:

  • BSc/BA or diploma in marketing, communications, or equivalent
  • Exceptional communication and writing skills
  • Passionate about writing and creating content in many forms 
  • Keen on tracking engagement and conversion metrics to understand how the content resonates with the intended audience
  • Self-starter who is curious enough about our market and prospects and wants to figure out which content is most valuable to them
  • Confidence in your own writing and editing
  • Well-organized and detail oriented
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, high change environment
What\'s In It for you?
  • Competitive salary
  • Flexibility in location (hybrid or remote work across Ontario)
  • Flexibility in hours (core hours 10am-3pm EST)
  • Comprehensive benefits, including wellness days
  • Perks to help set home office
  • Opportunity to make a difference in the supply chain!
  • Fun and friendly co-workers :) 
At OTTO we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Technical Deployment Specialist
item.description:
Description

Position at Clearpath Inc.

Position:              Technical Deployment Specialist 
Location:             Kitchener
Experience:        3+ years
Education:          Bachelors in relevant field
Division:              OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)
OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

The primary objective of the Technical Deployment Specialist (TDS) role is to act as the technical point of contact for a project during the deployment phase. Reporting to the Manager of the Project Management Office (PMO), the Technical Deployment Specialist works closely with the assigned Project Manager (PM) to ensure the technical deployment of a project goes as smoothly as possible. The Technical Deployment Specialist tracks and resolves technical issues and acts as Tier 1 support for both the Systems Engineer and the Project Manager assigned to the project. The Technical Deployment Specialist is the technical bridge/universal translator between the Project Manager and the OTTO Motors Engineering team.

Responsibilities of the Technical Deployment Specialist include:
  • Supplement the project ‘voice of the customer’ at the technical level.
  • Work with the Project Managers and Systems Engineers to plan and deploy projects after receiving a PO and leading up to and including a Site Acceptance Test.
  • Gain a broad exposure to all aspects of the OTTO Motors technology and interact effectively with varied departments.
  • Gain a working knowledge of the processes and workflows of the PMO and those of other OTTO Motors teams.
  • Have a familiarity with and understand the principal functions of all information systems used at OTTO Motors: Epicor, Jira, Salesforce, Elastic/Kibana, Wiki, Google Suite, OTTO Motors Knowledge Base, Arena/PLM.
  • Understand the basics of: AMR SW, AMR HW, Infrastructure (Fleet Manager SW, IT policies, Networking), Product capabilities/limitations, and best practices for all current and recent past products.
  • Troubleshoot issues with any of the aforementioned topics quickly and effectively, escalating in a timely manner when an issue requires a solution from a SME.
  • Assist with robot diagnostic data collection and primary triage for root cause analysis or escalation to Tier III or Tier IV support.
  • Reduce the number of \'direct-to-engineering\' escalations arising from on-site issues; this lets the developers focus on new features without getting distracted by minor issues.
  • Collaborate with OTTO Motors Engineering to troubleshoot project issues.
  • Pre-configure Fleet Manager OVA\'s (installation files) for deployment at customer sites and assist with issues arising during the installation process.
  • Act as primary IT/network SME on active deployments and assigned upgrades.
  • Keep track of the state of multiple project assignments at any given time, and maintain information records for each, from kickoff to handoff.
  • Self-prioritize workloads, often when under multiple \'crisis\' situations at customer sites.
  • Communicate effectively with SMEs, other OTTO Motors employees (of varying levels of technical expertise) and with the customer.
  • Translating high-level technical concepts into easy-to-understand terms.
  • Prepare technical documentation about each deployment to facilitate the transition from the deployment phase to the support phase.
  • Understand the product capabilities and limitations and explain the context of each to different parties, including internal to OTTO Motors.

About You

You want to work for a fast-moving company that thinks big and dreams huge. You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done. You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems. Oh, and you have some form of higher education with the common sense to back it up.

Required skills:

  • Previous experience in a technical customer facing role
  • College diploma in engineering or other technical field
  • Excellent organizational skills with a demonstrated ability to prioritize and analyze difficult issues
  • Strong negotiation and communication skills, both verbal and written
  • Ability to multi-task and meet deadlines in a fast-paced high mix low volume environment
  • Ability to work unsupervised while still effectively achieving goals
  • Strong technical aptitude and ability to learn new skills and tools
  • Background or exposure to an industrial automation environment
  • Proven ability to work cooperatively with others in a team environment
  • Technical writing/communication

 
At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Senior Systems Integrator
item.description:
Description

Position:            Senior Systems Engineer
Location:           South-Western Ontario           
Education:         College Diploma / University Degree in an Engineering Discipline
Division:             OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

The Systems Engineering (SE) team works closely with our Project Management Office (PMO) within our professional services organization to deliver business value to our end users, channel partners, and for OTTO Motors.  SEs design and implement fleets of OTTO autonomous mobile robots (AMR) and software at our customer facilities. In addition, the SE team delivers training to our integration partners and end-users, and evaluates use cases to establish guidelines, standards, and best practices for how OTTO Motors products can be used by the market, specifically by our integrator network. Furthermore, the SE team is a major contributor to defining our product requirements and is a major influencer of our product roadmap.

Primary responsibilities include:

  • understanding customer requirements and ensuring clarity of all requirements prior to proceeding with the detailed design;
  • consulting with applications engineering during the requirements and concept definition process; documenting/updating the requirements when needed
  • detailed design & integration of AMR systems using OTTO Motors products to meet the customer requirements; this includes design of the workflow as well as the communications required from our system to any third party automation systems in the facility where the system is being installed
  • authoring & executing acceptance test plans for validation of system functionality and performance;
  • optimizing system performance through analysis, simulation, and experimentation;
  • project planning for the deliverables and work packages you own;
  • communicating technical details and status to the customer and broader project team;
  • consulting with integration partners on all of the above

Additional responsibilities include:

  • authoring new product requirements based on the lessons learned from your design and commissioning activities;
  • working with the systems engineering team to improve department tools, processes, and working relationships with other departments;
  • delivery of training to integration partners as well as end users
  • ability to travel for business within North America, Europe and Asia; ~30 - 40 % travel commitment (NOTE: No travel outside of North America currently with the COVID-19 travel restrictions)

About You

You want to work for a fast-moving company that thinks big and dreams huge. You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done. You want to be surrounded by people who are creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems.  You have a customer-first mentality and strive to exceed customer expectations.

As an experienced Systems Engineer you believe that the final product is more than the sum of its component parts and live in this area of optimising the intersection of the components. You are no stranger to the intricacies of engineering compromise and the need to consider all aspects of the whole when crafting the ultimate fulfillment of the system requirements. Your mastery comes from years of experience in designing and integrating complex systems solutions for industrial automation applications. You are able to represent a complex system via a simplified block diagram representation to convey the objective and details to the end user systematically.

Required background:

  • 5+ years of experience commissioning & integrating industrial automated equipment or software that interfaces to the equipment
  • college/university diploma or degree in an engineering, design, or industrial controls type of field
  • experience working directly with clients/end-users

Required skills:

  • planning and organization (how to approach and solve a problem, work breakdown to achieve the end goal, etc.)
  • strong communicator, verbal and written
  • self-motivated and organized with a keen eye for detail
  • ability to navigate through and program PLCs
  • interpretation & design analysis of mechanical drawings and electrical schematics

Bonus for experience:

  • data analysis experience
  • authoring and modifying software code (python, C++, or other
  • experience with inductive automation ignition OPC/UA software
  • familiarity of working with Linux

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Systems Integration Engineer
item.description:
Description

Position:              Systems Integration Engineer        
Location:             USA - Indiana, Ohio, Kentucky, Illinois     
Experience:        3+ years of relevant work experience (IC3 Intermediate)
Education:          Electrical/Mechanical/Industrial Controls/Mechatronics/Systems Engineering related field
Division:              OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)
OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

The Systems Engineering (SE) team works closely with our Project Management Office (PMO) within our professional services organization to deliver business value to our end users, channel partners, and for OTTO Motors.  SEs design and implement fleets of OTTO autonomous mobile robots (AMR) and software at our customer facilities. In addition, the SE team delivers training to our integration partners and end-users, and evaluates use cases to establish guidelines, standards, and best practices for how OTTO Motors products can be used by the market, specifically by our integrator network. Furthermore, the SE team is a major contributor to defining our product requirements and is a major influencer of our product roadmap.

Primary responsibilities:

  • detailed design of AMR systems using OTTO Motors products to meet the customer requirements; this includes workflow design, attachment design, map design and development/modification middle layer software logic using Ignition OPC/UA and/or PLC logic design and modification
  • authoring & executing acceptance test plans for validation of system functionality and performance;
  • commissioning & integration of AMR systems at client facilities throughout the world; this includes traveling to customer or integration partner facility for on-site deployment and integration with facility side automation equipment
  • optimizing system performance through analysis, simulation, and experimentation;
  • project planning for the deliverables and work packages you own;
  • communicating technical details and status to the customer and broader project team;
  • consulting with integration partners on all of the above
  • delivery of training to integration partners as well as end users
  • troubleshooting software & hardware technical issues using internal tools available; solving new and challenging technical problems related to the above

Additional responsibilities:

  • authoring new product requirements based on the lessons learned from your design and commissioning activities;
  • working with the systems engineering team to improve department tools, processes, and working relationships with other departments;
  • ability to travel for business within North America, Europe and Asia; ~35 - 45 % travel commitment over the year (travel mostly contained to Canada and USA).  Trips to site would typically be 2 weeks on - 2 weeks off during the project integration phase.

About You

You want to work for a fast-moving company that thinks big and dreams huge. You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done. You want to be surrounded by people who are creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems.  You have a customer-first mentality and strive to exceed customer expectations.

Your mastery comes from years of experience in designing and integrating complex systems solutions for industrial automation applications. You are able to represent a complex system via a simplified block diagram representation to convey the objective and details to the end-user systematically.

Required background:

  • 3+ years of relevant work experience
  • 3+ years of experience commissioning & integrating industrial automated equipment or software that interfaces to the equipment
  • college/university diploma or degree in an engineering, design, or industrial controls type of field
  • experience working directly with clients/end-users
  • experience in troubleshooting and repairing electro-mechanical systems/subsystems
  • interpretation & design analysis of mechanical drawings and electrical schematics
  • PLC design and integration experience
  • demonstrated ability to work with Linux
  • planning and organization (how to approach and solve a problem, work breakdown to achieve the end goal, etc.)
  • strong communicator, verbal and written
  • self-motivated and organized with a keen eye for detail

Bonus for experience:

  • training users of automated equipment/software
  • authoring and modifying software code (python, C++, or other)
  • experience with inductive Automation Ignition OPC/UA software

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Technical Support Specialist (Rotating shifts)
item.description:
Description

Position:      Technical Support Specialist (Rotating shifts)

Location:     Kitchener

Job  Type:   Full-Time Permanent

Experience: 2-5 years customer-facing work experience

Education:   Bachelors in related field

Division:      OTTO Motors 

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)
OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

Clearpath is seeking a Technical Support Specialist to join our highly skilled team in Kitchener. At Clearpath we believe that every client is a VIP and we need someone who will obsessively focus on making our customers successful.

You will be responsible for providing remote post-sales customer service and technical support to our rapidly growing list of customers globally.  Don’t worry if you encounter a complex technical challenge, we have a team of insanely smart robotics engineers (the brain surgeons of robotics!) who will help you troubleshoot.

Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Advanced Level technical support to our customers
  • On-call Escalation Support
  • Organizing warranty parts and repairs
  • Triage and customer assistance
  • Escalating tickets and coordinating engineering teams with support efforts
  • On-boarding new customers
  • Acting as a customer advocate internally
  • Chasing down a solution internally to a deployed customers issue
  • Supporting our partners deploying systems at new customer sites

About You

You want to work for a fast-moving company that thinks big and dreams huge.  You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done.  You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems.   Oh, and you have some form of higher education with the common sense to back it up.

Client-facing Skills:

  • 2-5 years customer-facing work experience
  • Strong communicator (written and verbal), with excellent phone and email manners
  • Naturally friendly, energetic and empathetic personality
  • Well organized and responsive, with great problem solving and negotiation skills
  • Passionate about making people happy through exceptional service
  • Basic grasp of technology and robotics
  • Solid grasp of software architecture, and IT systems
  • Communicating technical ideas in an easy to understand way

Technical Skills:

  • Hardware/Electrical hands-on troubleshooting
  • Computer networking and applicable industrial standards
  • Data analytics

Bonus points for:

  • Linux (Ubuntu), C, C++, Python
  • ROS knowledge
  • Ability to work evenings 

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.
