item.title: Account Executive
item.description:
Description

Position:          Account Executive 
Location:          Remote - North America
Experience:      5 + Years’ experience selling technical products, preferably material handling solutions
Division:          OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)
OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

Clearpath is automating the world and we need your help.  Got what it takes?

We’re looking for a passionate, self-driven, and motivated Account Executive (AEx) to join our OTTO Motors Sales Organization. We strive to become the ‘renaissance people’ of deal-making, with proven skills across all account functions: strategic account planning, business development, direct technical sales, and account administration. This is a remote position, with 50% travel required – you will receive support from the team regardless of location.

You will:

  • Pursue target accounts in your territory, infiltrate those accounts at the highest decision-making level, and secure that business.
  • Devise account strategies that leverage OTTO solutions and go-to-market strategy to expand OTTO within target accounts
  • Develop business relationships across the organization elevating Clearpath’s position within the executive ranks. 
  • Work with clients to identify materials handling automation opportunities in their facilities, promote and demonstrate the OTTO solution and engage the customers in projects with compelling business cases.    
  • Be responsible for pipeline growth and revenue growth in your territory.
  • Devise your personal strategy to systematically conquer your slice of the globe... and we will do everything we can to support you along the way!  
  • The AEx reports directly to the Director of Sales. You will be paid a base salary plus commissions and benefits.

Ideal Sales Characteristics:

Our next AEx is a sharp, articulate and persuasive person, who is 100% comfortable spending their days talking to highly-technical Production Engineers, Facility Directors and VP and C Level Executives.

  • Coachability – ability to understand feedback and change behavior
  • Curiosity – ability and desire to ask probing questions
  • Prior Success – based on previous sales results and/or ambition
  • Intelligence – ability to become a subject matter expert
  • Emotional Intelligence – self-awareness, self-management, social awareness and relationship building with others 
  • Passion – brings an intense enthusiasm to the team
  • Work Ethic – willingness to put in the extra effort to succeed
  • Preparation – technical aptitude of product and market/buyer understanding
  • Competitiveness – a drive to succeed that enables higher performance
  • Adaptability - ability to adapt and succeed in a fast-paced environment
  • Culture Fit – fit with company core values and culture

Required Skills and Experience: 

  • University degree in a STEM, Business or related field
  • Minimum 5+ years of relevant industry experience in a variety of technical roles including Applications Engineering, Project/Program Management and Technical Sales
  • Proven success in Business Development, Direct Sales and/or Key Account Management
  • Experience selling to mid market and enterprise organizations
  • Experience with CRM products such as Salesforce.com is an asset
  • Excellent communication skills, and the ability to deliver compelling presentations to prospects, customers, and partners.
  • Strategic thinker who is also hands-on to get results
  • Ability to travel to customers 25-50% of the time.

What’s in it for you:

  • Work-life balance - vacation, flexible long weekends, half-day birthdays and wellness days
  • Flexibility in when you work, core hours are 10am-3pm EST
  • Competitive salary and career growth opportunities
  • Comprehensive benefits for you and your family to support your health and wellness
  • Additional perks to get you set up at home/work
  • Opportunity to make a difference with the world’s deadliest, dirtiest and dangerous jobs
  • Amazing co-workers to laugh and have fun

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Account Representative
item.description:
Description

Position:           Account Representative

Location:           Remote/Virtual 

Experience:     2-4 years account development or Inside Sales experience

Division:            OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)
OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

You will be accountable for qualifying inbound leads, cold calling, networking, and other methods of producing interest from potential customers. You will design persuasive communication plans to qualify prospects into potential customers. You will work directly with marketing, technical staff, sales executives, and sales management to ensure that you are providing a high-quality experience for all prospects and helping interested organizations understand how to use OTTO in their business. 

Responsibilities and Duties:

  • Manage, qualify and nurture the inbound lead flow to determine if they meet the appropriate qualification criteria to be transferred to the sales team
  • Collaborate with marketing and sales to develop outbound lead generation campaigns and design lead capture and nurture processes
  • Generate demand by building targeted lists for outreach
  • Manage relationships leads that are being nurtured
  • Provide feedback on quality of leads being generated regularly. Collaborate with the team on how quality can be improved.
  • Follow-up with the sales team on converted Leads to track status and quality of the leads as they move through the sales cycle for intelligence on quality and conversion rates
  • Own Lead Data Accuracy in systems
  • Report on key metrics on a regular basis that measure the effectiveness of the process.
  • Account Representatives are evaluated on the number of qualified leads they move through the pipeline
  • Research and cultivate an accurate perception of the organization’s mission and goals
  • Attend industry functions, including conferences and association events, and contribute information and feedback on upcoming market trends

Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree
  • 2-4 years of account development or Inside sales experience
  • Excellent verbal and written communication
  • Consistent positive and professional attitude
  • Ability to handle pressures and meet deadlines
  • Excellent time management and organizational skills
  • Obsessive attention to detail and data accuracy
  • In-depth knowledge of the industry and current events
  • Working knowledge of Lead generation process and implementation of those processed in a technology stack (Salesforce.com a must)

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Customer Engineer, Data Analytics, Public Sector
item.description:
2022-05-23T21:32:01.259Z

Customer Engineer, Data Analytics, Public Sector

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Toronto, ON, Canada
Apply

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor\'s degree in Computer Science, related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • Experience in virtualization or cloud native architectures in a customer-facing or support role.
  • Experience with cloud computing (e.g., cloud market) and delivering technical presentations.
  • Experience with analytic warehouse solutions, “Big Data” technologies, real time streaming, performance, and scalability optimizations.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Master\'s degree in Computer Science or related technical field.
  • Technical sales experience in the fields of cloud computing, data, information lifecycle management, and Big Data.
  • Experience in writing code in a common development languages such as Java, Python, JavaScript, C++, Scala, R, or Go.
  • Experience with developing data warehousing, data lakes, batch, or real-time event processing and exact transform and load (ETL) workflows solutions (e.g., Informatica, Talend, Alooma, SAP, Data Services).
  • Knowledge of Linux and an ability to address domain name systems, transmission control protocol, firewalls, proxy servers, load balancing, virtual private network, and virtual private cloud.

About the job

The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and build what\'s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. Our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will play a key role in understanding the needs of our customers and help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.

As a Customer Engineer, you will work with the Sales team to introduce Google Cloud to our customers. You will help prospective and existing customers and partners understand the power of Google Cloud, develop creative cloud solutions and architectures to solve their business challenges, and problem-solve any potential roadblocks.

Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

Responsibilities

  • Work with the team to identify and qualify business opportunities, identify key customer technical objections, and develop a strategy to resolve technical blockers.
  • Manage the technical relationship with Google’s customers (e.g., managing product and solution briefings, proof-of-concept work, and the coordination of additional technical resources).
  • Work with customers to demonstrate and prototype Google Cloud product integrations in customer and partner environments.
  • Prepare and deliver product messaging in an effort to highlight the Google Cloud Platform value proposition, using techniques that include presentations, product demonstrations, white papers, and request for information response documents.
  • Travel to customer sites, conferences, and other events.

Location

item.title: Video Measurement Lead, Large Customer Sales
item.description:
2022-05-10T19:02:40.986Z

Video Measurement Lead, Large Customer Sales

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Toronto, ON, Canada
Apply

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor\'s degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of experience in digital media/advertising analytics, or analytics in a consultative position.
  • Experience working with data sets by translating insights into actionable strategies.
  • Experience working within SQL.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience with dashboard creation via data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Datastudio etc.).
  • Experience with marketing analytics, return on investment/financial modeling, creative testing, Brand Health Tracking, and statistical analysis.
  • Experience in marshaling data sets and creating data narratives via historical analysis and market trends.
  • Experience with and an understanding of advanced statistical modeling and quantitative analysis techniques (e.g., MMM, MTA, propensity modeling, cluster analysis, etc.) using languages such as Python or R.
  • Ability to understand partners’ strategic background and objectives.

About the job

The Brand Acceleration Team (BAT) is made up of Brand Strategists, Measurement Experts, and Insights Specialists with expertise across brand building, creative, media, and measurement. Our goal is to educate, inspire, and strategize the best possible ways to build a client\'s brand using the power of sight, sound, and motion (e.g., ahem, video).

As a Video Measurement Lead, you will play a critical role in helping customers drive business growth through YouTube. You will be responsible for assessing video measurement needs across clients, conducting meta analyses to develop best practices, and crafting measurement plans/playbooks for execution by client teams.You will coordinate with the Brand Activation Team, conducting internal and external research projects, analyzing data from different sources, and formulating clear insights and impactful recommendations that drive our clients’ businesses forward. You will be a thought leader for how YouTube approaches Video campaign optimization/measurement at scale, and support with adapted strategies and new capabilities building client’s Video Measurement Maturity at scale. In partnership with stakeholders, the Video Measurement Lead will develop compelling narratives and recommendations to share insights with clients and the industry.

Our Large Customer Sales teams partner closely with many of the world’s biggest advertisers and agencies to develop digital solutions that build businesses and brands. We enjoy a bird’s eye view on the massive transformation occurring as advertising shifts to mobile and online platforms. We\'re uniquely situated to help shape how companies grow their businesses in the digital age. We advise clients on Google\'s broad range of products across search, video and mobile to help them connect instantly and seamlessly with their audiences.

Responsibilities

  • Act as the subject matter expert on Google and YouTube data to measure and drive growth of video as a medium to deliver customer objectives across upper and low funnel media goals. 
  • Ensure a smooth execution of Brand Activation Team Video measurement plans, conducting scaled meta analyses across Campaign Reach/Frequency goals, Campaign Creative Effectiveness, Brand Health tracking, and Brand Lift studies in order to develop industry level learnings to get the best out of YouTube to build and drive a brand. 
  • Analyze proprietary data, leverage various modeling techniques to solve video/brand challenges, uncover opportunities to build solutions/new capabilities, and develop playbooks for client teams to activate at scale. 
  • Coordinate plans/playbooks with Analytical Leads to establish Video Measurement practices, advise on methodologies, campaign key performance indicators and provide guidance on measurement plans.

Location

About the job

The Brand Acceleration Team (BAT) is made up of Brand Strategists, Measurement Experts, and Insights Specialists with expertise across brand building, creative, media, and measurement. Our goal is to educate, inspire, and strategize the best possible ways to build a client\'s brand using the power of sight, sound, and motion (e.g., ahem, video).

As a Video Measurement Lead, you will play a critical role in helping customers drive business growth through YouTube. You will be responsible for assessing video measurement needs across clients, conducting meta analyses to develop best practices, and crafting measurement plans/playbooks for execution by client teams.You will coordinate with the Brand Activation Team, conducting internal and external research projects, analyzing data from different sources, and formulating clear insights and impactful recommendations that drive our clients’ businesses forward. You will be a thought leader for how YouTube approaches Video campaign optimization/measurement at scale, and support with adapted strategies and new capabilities building client’s Video Measurement Maturity at scale. In partnership with stakeholders, the Video Measurement Lead will develop compelling narratives and recommendations to share insights with clients and the industry.

Our Large Customer Sales teams partner closely with many of the world’s biggest advertisers and agencies to develop digital solutions that build businesses and brands. We enjoy a bird’s eye view on the massive transformation occurring as advertising shifts to mobile and online platforms. We\'re uniquely situated to help shape how companies grow their businesses in the digital age. We advise clients on Google\'s broad range of products across search, video and mobile to help them connect instantly and seamlessly with their audiences.

Responsibilities

  • Act as the subject matter expert on Google and YouTube data to measure and drive growth of video as a medium to deliver customer objectives across upper and low funnel media goals. 
  • Ensure a smooth execution of Brand Activation Team Video measurement plans, conducting scaled meta analyses across Campaign Reach/Frequency goals, Campaign Creative Effectiveness, Brand Health tracking, and Brand Lift studies in order to develop industry level learnings to get the best out of YouTube to build and drive a brand. 
  • Analyze proprietary data, leverage various modeling techniques to solve video/brand challenges, uncover opportunities to build solutions/new capabilities, and develop playbooks for client teams to activate at scale. 
  • Coordinate plans/playbooks with Analytical Leads to establish Video Measurement practices, advise on methodologies, campaign key performance indicators and provide guidance on measurement plans.

Location

item.title: Analytical Lead, Retail
item.description:
2022-06-16T00:01:43.739Z

Analytical Lead, Retail

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Toronto, ON, Canada
Apply

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor\'s degree or equivalent practical experience
  • 8 years of experience in media analytics, advertising sales, digital media and marketing, consulting, or financial analysis

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience using search engine marketing (Google Ads), website analytics platforms (Google Analytics and other measurement suite products), and brand analysis techniques (upper funnel analysis)
  • Demonstrated analytical background, and experience with marketing analytics, financial modeling, or statistical analysis
  • Experience using SQL to extract and manipulate data, or with other programming/scripting languages (R, Python, C++)
  • Ability to analyze large datasets and translate them into actionable insights

About the job

Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing businesses grow. Using your relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google\'s key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.

As an Analytical Lead, you will be a strategic analyst, advisor, and consultant providing data supported insights to clients across the finance and travel industry, along with agencies to help improve their business. You will also be an influencer to teammates and clients in how they think about measuring the value that they get from their marketing efforts. In this role, you\'ll work with some of Google\'s most advanced performance advertisers to prove and maximize Google\'s impact on their business objectives.

You will work with advertising agencies and clients as a team member on Google\'s industry-focused Sales team, exchanging knowledge regarding client and agency needs within specific industry sectors. You\'ll work with a cross-functional team to present integrated, data-driven business opportunities based on internal and external tools analysis. Lastly, you\'ll own measurement for your vertical and work with advertising agencies and clients to create impact on their business.

Our Large Customer Sales teams partner closely with many of the world’s biggest advertisers and agencies to develop digital solutions that build businesses and brands. We enjoy a bird’s eye view on the massive transformation occurring as advertising shifts to mobile and online platforms. We\'re uniquely situated to help shape how companies grow their businesses in the digital age. We advise clients on Google\'s broad range of products across search, video and mobile to help them connect instantly and seamlessly with their audiences.

Responsibilities

  • Build and own client relationships with media and analytics stakeholders, and influence investment and measurement decisions based on risks and impact to their business.
  • Lead client-specific Measurement Plans that define roadmap to improve client’s measurement and attribution maturity based on client’s biggest measurement and attribution gaps.
  • Advise clients on experiments to demonstrate the impact of Google media (value of search, etc.) and design analyses that uncover growth opportunities using products, market data, and platforms to improve media performance.
  • Build ways to solve common client business needs and share best practices (analysis, tools, frameworks) and client successes across industries.
  • Drive adoption of measurement and attribution solutions to better value Google and non-Google media, increase measurement maturity, and quantify business impact of media recommendation based on client business objectives and craft recommendations to lead to client action.

Location

item.title: Research Intern, MS, Fall 2022
item.description:
2022-04-18T14:02:04.015Z

Research Intern, MS, Fall 2022

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Waterloo, ON, Canada
  • + 1 more location
Apply

Please complete your application before August 26th, 2022. Participation in the internship program requires that you are located in Canada for the duration of the internship program.

NOTE: This internship is intended for students who are pursuing a MS degree with an anticipated graduation date before December 2023, depending on their program and unique circumstances. If you are graduating after December 2023, we encourage you to apply to the Student Researcher opening.

To start the application process, you will need an updated CV or resume and a current unofficial or official transcript in English (PDFs preferred). Please ensure your anticipated graduation dates (in MM/YY) and any proficiency in coding languages are listed on resume.


Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Waterloo, ON, Canada; Toronto, ON, Canada.

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Currently enrolled in a Master\'s degree in Computer Science, Linguistics, Statistics, Biostatistics, Applied Mathematics, Operations Research, Economics, Natural Sciences, or a related technical field.
  • Experience in one area of computer science (e.g., Natural Language Understanding, Computer Vision, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Algorithmic Foundations of Optimization, Quantum Information Science, Data Science, Software Engineering, or similar).

Preferred qualifications:

  • Currently attending a degree program in Canada.
  • Availability to work full-time for a minimum of 12 weeks outside of university term. Ability to return to a degree program after completion of the internship.
  • Experience as a researcher, including internships, full-time, or at a lab.
  • Experience contributing to research communities or efforts, including publishing papers in major conferences or journals.
  • Experience with one or more general purpose programming languages
  • Ability to speak and write in English fluently.

About the job

Join us for a full-time, 12-14 week paid internship that offers personal and professional development, an executive speaker series, and community-building. Research happens across Google everyday, in many different teams. Our research has already impacted user-facing services across Google, including Search, Maps, and Google Now, and is central to the success of Google Cloud and our planet-scale computing, storage, and networking infrastructure.

Research Interns aren\'t cloistered in the lab, but instead they work closely with Engineers to discover, invent, and build at the largest scale. Ideas may come from internal projects. From creating experiments and prototyping implementations to designing new architectures, Research Interns work on challenges in artificial intelligence, machine perception, data mining, machine learning, natural language understanding, privacy, computer architecture, networking, operating systems, storage and data management, and much more.

Google Research addresses challenges that define the technology of today and tomorrow. From conducting fundamental research to influencing product development, our research teams have the opportunity to impact technology used by billions of people every day.

Our teams aspire to make discoveries that impact everyone, and core to our approach is sharing our research and tools to fuel progress in the field -- we publish regularly in academic journals, release projects as open source, and apply research to Google products.

Responsibilities

  • Develop and execute a research agenda.
  • Create and support a productive and innovative team, including working with peers, managers, and teams.

Locations

To navigate, press the arrow keys.

item.title: Research Intern, BS, Fall 2022
item.description:
2022-04-18T14:02:05.568Z

Research Intern, BS, Fall 2022

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Waterloo, ON, Canada
  • + 1 more location
Apply

Please complete your application before August 26th, 2022. Participation in the internship program requires that you are located in Canada for the duration of the internship program.

NOTE: This internship is intended for students who are pursuing a BS degree with an anticipated graduation date before December 2023, depending on their program and unique circumstances. If you are graduating after December 2023, we encourage you to apply to the Student Researcher opening.

To start the application process, you will need an updated CV or resume and a current unofficial or official transcript in English (PDFs preferred). Please ensure your anticipated graduation dates (in MM/YY) and any proficiency in coding languages are listed on resume.


Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Waterloo, ON, Canada; Toronto, ON, Canada.

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Currently enrolled in a Bachelor\'s degree in Computer Science, Linguistics, Statistics, Biostatistics, Applied Mathematics, Operations Research, Economics, Natural Sciences, or a related technical field.
  • Experience in one area of computer science (e.g., Natural Language Understanding, Computer Vision, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Algorithmic Foundations of Optimization, Quantum Information Science, Data Science, Software Engineering, or similar).

Preferred qualifications:

  • Currently attending a degree program in Canada.
  • Availability to work full-time for a minimum of 12 weeks outside of university term. Ability to return to a degree program after completion of the internship.
  • Experience as a researcher, including internships, full-time, or at a lab.
  • Experience contributing to research communities or efforts, including publishing papers in major conferences or journals.
  • Experience with one or more general purpose programming languages.
  • Ability to speak and write in English fluently.

About the job

Join us for a full-time, 12-14 week paid internship that offers personal and professional development, an executive speaker series, and community-building. Research happens across Google everyday, in many different teams. Our research has already impacted user-facing services across Google, including Search, Maps, and Google Now, and is central to the success of Google Cloud and our planet-scale computing, storage, and networking infrastructure.

Research Interns aren\'t cloistered in the lab, but instead they work closely with Engineers to discover, invent, and build at the largest scale. Ideas may come from internal projects. From creating experiments and prototyping implementations to designing new architectures, Research Interns work on challenges in artificial intelligence, machine perception, data mining, machine learning, natural language understanding, privacy, computer architecture, networking, operating systems, storage and data management, and much more.

Google Research addresses challenges that define the technology of today and tomorrow. From conducting fundamental research to influencing product development, our research teams have the opportunity to impact technology used by billions of people every day.

Our teams aspire to make discoveries that impact everyone, and core to our approach is sharing our research and tools to fuel progress in the field -- we publish regularly in academic journals, release projects as open source, and apply research to Google products.

Responsibilities

  • Develop and execute a research agenda.
  • Create and support a productive and innovative team, including working with peers, managers, and teams.

Locations

item.title: Enterprise Customer Specialist, Business Application Platform, Google Cloud
item.description:
2022-06-09T19:32:05.536Z

Enterprise Customer Specialist, Business Application Platform, Google Cloud

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Toronto, ON, Canada
Apply

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor\'s degree in Computer Science or a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of experience as a technical sales specialist in a cloud computing environment or equivalent experience in a customer-facing role.
  • Experience with web services and API technologies such as HTTP, SOAP and REST.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience in areas such as API management, microservice frameworks, and PaaS.
  • Experience with legacy and modern application development, container orchestration systems, middleware technologies, or other applicable platforms..
  • Knowledge of end-to-end security and understanding of popular API security technologies such as OAuth, mTLS, SAML, JWT, and SSO.
  • Understanding of cloud, multi/hybrid-cloud strategies and associated technologies.
  • Ability to travel as needed, and to work flexible hours with prospects in different geographies/with a distributed team.

About the job

Apigee Edge is an advanced API platform that enables enterprises to create, manage, secure and scale APIs. Using Apigee, enterprises can design and deploy API proxies in public and private clouds, secure data in transit with OAuth 2.0, SAML and two-way TLS, protect against traffic spikes by adding dynamic routing, caching and rate-limiting policies to APIs, and measure the success of both API operations and API business with end-to-end analytics.

As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will help businesses of all sizes leverage technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.

Adopting cloud and modernizing IT are the priorities for enterprises as they look to be successful and competitive in this digital world. To drive this transformation, enterprises are increasingly adopting API-first approaches connecting services across hybrid and multi-cloud environments. Google Cloud\'s Apigee empowers organizations to accelerate their business by unlocking the value of data, driving internal efficiencies, and delivering modern applications.

As an Enterprise Customer Specialist, you will influence and lead enterprise customers through their transformation journey. You\'ll liaise with the Product Management and Development teams to stay up-to-date with industry trends and devise enhancements to Google Cloud products. You will help prospective and existing customers and partners understand the power of Google Cloud, develop creative cloud solutions and architectures to solve their business challenges, and problem-solve any potential technical roadblocks.

Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

Responsibilities

  • Provide API management and application modernization expertise to support the technical relationship with Google’s customers.
  • Work with the account team to identify and qualify business opportunities. Understand key customer objections and develop a strategy to resolve technical blockers.
  • Develop Proofs of Concept, presentations, and demos with a clear plan to take a prospect successfully through the evaluation process and provide excellent customer service.
  • Travel to customer sites, conferences, and other related events as required.
  • Partner directly with Product Management to prioritize solutions impacting customer adoption to Google Cloud.

Location

item.title: Partner Operations Manager, Music, YouTube
item.description:
2022-04-29T16:31:57.431Z

Partner Operations Manager, Music, YouTube

  • YouTube
  • In-office:
    Toronto, ON, Canada
Apply

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor\'s degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 2 years of experience in customer support or client services experience troubleshooting and resolving customer issues.
  • Experience working in the Music industry, with Music stakeholders, or in Music Rights Management.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Knowledge of data analytics, data visualization, spreadsheets, and/or SQL.
  • Knowledge of the Canadian Music industry and current Canadian policies.
  • Ability to troubleshoot complex, technical issues.
  • Ability to be proactive, making constructive suggestions, and coming up with innovative ways to scale initiatives.
  • Ability to manage competing priorities and multiple clients.

About the job

As a member of the Partner Operations team, you\'ll analyze top issues facing our content creators, work with cross-functional teams to resolve them, and help manage support operations. Whether directly engaging with our biggest creators, surfacing problems to our technical teams, driving analytical insights, or liaising with vendors to provide stellar support, you\'ll drive reach, satisfaction, and resolution — making YouTube an exceptional user experience for everyone.

In this role, you will provide YouTube support to some of our managed Label partners. You will become a YouTube product expert, solve the day-to-day issues of our Music partners, and identify common trends that our partners face. You will also be responsible for advocating on behalf of our partners to cross-functional teams in order to drive product solutions, and for developing process improvements that enhance internal operations. You will work closely with other partner-facing teams to provide value-add services to help increase our Music partner\'s growth.

At YouTube, we believe that everyone deserves to have a voice, and that the world is a better place when we listen, share, and build community through our stories. We work together to give everyone the power to share their story, explore what they love, and connect with one another in the process. Working at the intersection of cutting-edge technology and boundless creativity, we move at the speed of culture with a shared goal to show people the world. We explore new ideas, solve real problems, and have fun — and we do it all together.

Responsibilities

  • Provide operational support to managed partners on the YouTube platform, primarily through email communication.
  • Serve as a consultant to internal, cross-functional stakeholders on the YouTube product. Work with assigned Strategic Partner Managers and Partner Technology Managers to develop business plans and share insights for partner growth.
  • Drive, measure, and analyze overall partner performance as well as streamline operational workflows and process improvements.
  • Contribute to scaling Partner Operations for YouTube through innovation, efficiency gains, and root cause analysis.
  • Evaluate data both quantitatively and qualitatively, and use data to visually tell a compelling story.

Location

To navigate, press the arrow keys.

item.title: Enterprise Sales Developer, Security and Compliance, Google Cloud
item.description:
2021-10-04T13:25:23.445Z

Enterprise Sales Developer, Security and Compliance, Google Cloud

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Toronto, ON, Canada
Apply

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor\'s degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • Experience in virtualization or cloud native architectures in a customer-facing or support role.
  • Experience addressing CIO and CISO concerns about security and compliance risks.
  • Experience in performing technical presentations or public speaking.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Advanced degree (i.e. MBA, Master\'s).
  • Experience with tools, technology and best practices in network security, data protection and identity and access management.
  • Technical business experience or professional consulting experience.
  • Knowledge of ISO 27001, SOC 2/3 audit, FedRamp, PCI, and HIPAA.

About the job

The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and evolve their business through the use of Google’s global network, web-scale data centers and software infrastructure. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.

As a Sales Developer focused on Security and Compliance, you\'ll address technical security and compliance challenges during engagements with customers and partner with internal stakeholders to improve products and build solutions.

In this role, you will be the security and compliance subject matter expert to differentiate Google Cloud to our customers. You will help prospective customers and partners recognize the power of Google Cloud, explaining technical features, helping customers design architectures, and conduct problem-solving for any potential roadblocks.

Google Cloud provides organizations with leading infrastructure, platform capabilities and industry solutions. We deliver enterprise-grade cloud solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology to help companies operate more efficiently and adapt to changing needs, giving customers a foundation for the future. Customers in more than 150 countries turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to solve their most critical business problems.

Responsibilities

  • Work with customers to resolve existing and potential technical security and compliance obstacles, to adoption and consumption of Google Cloud services.
  • Enhance knowledge and drive technical security and compliance enablement internally at Google Cloud, and create best practices for our customers.
  • Work cross-functionally as a customer advocate to provide insights and contribute to programs in areas of security, privacy, and regulatory compliance with internal teams, e.g, Marketing, Product Development, Legal, and Policy teams.
  • Serve as a public advocate of Google Cloud and Cloud Computing at conferences, industry training, and related events.

Location

To navigate, press the arrow keys.

item.title: Technical Sales Specialist, Infrastructure Modernization, Google Cloud
item.description:
2022-06-29T20:31:47.020Z

Technical Sales Specialist, Infrastructure Modernization, Google Cloud

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Toronto, ON, Canada
Apply

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • Experience in performing technical presentations or public speaking.
  • Experience in virtualization or cloud native architectures in a customer-facing or support role.
  • Experience with workload migrations, analyzing factors such as scalability, disaster recovery, and high availability.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Advanced education in technical field (Computer Science, Engineering and Mathematics).
  • Experience with legacy and modern application development, cloud service delivery and deployment.
  • Experience with application development technologies, architecting and developing software or infrastructure for scalable and secure distributed systems.
  • Experience with Relational Databases, NoSQL Databases and/or Big Data technologies and containers.
  • Advanced understanding of IaaS, PaaS, FaaS (XaaS).

About the job

The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and build what\'s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. Our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will play a key role in understanding the needs of our customers and help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.

As a Technical Specialist, you will work with the Sales team to introduce Google Cloud to our customers. You will help prospective, existing customers and partners understand the power of Google Cloud, develop creative cloud solutions and architectures to solve their business challenges, and problem-solve any potential technical roadblocks.

Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

Responsibilities

  • Work to identify and qualify business opportunities, identify key customer technical objections and develop a strategy to resolve technical blockers.
  • Manage technical relationships with Google’s customers, including managing product and solution briefings, proof-of-concept work, and the coordination of additional technical resources.
  • Work with customers to demonstrate and prototype Google Cloud product integrations, guide customers through assessments of their existing legacy application environments, provide recommendations on a prioritization roadmap for application modernization, and identify applications for migration to hybrid-cloud computing models.
  • Recommend integration strategies, enterprise architectures, platforms and application infrastructure required to successfully implement a complete solution using best practices on Google Cloud.
  • Travel to customer sites, conferences, and other related events.

The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and build what\'s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. Our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will play a key role in understanding the needs of our customers and help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.

As a Technical Specialist, you will work with the Sales team to introduce Google Cloud to our customers. You will help prospective, existing customers and partners understand the power of Google Cloud, develop creative cloud solutions and architectures to solve their business challenges, and problem-solve any potential technical roadblocks.

Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

Responsibilities

  • Work to identify and qualify business opportunities, identify key customer technical objections and develop a strategy to resolve technical blockers.
  • Manage technical relationships with Google’s customers, including managing product and solution briefings, proof-of-concept work, and the coordination of additional technical resources.
  • Work with customers to demonstrate and prototype Google Cloud product integrations, guide customers through assessments of their existing legacy application environments, provide recommendations on a prioritization roadmap for application modernization, and identify applications for migration to hybrid-cloud computing models.
  • Recommend integration strategies, enterprise architectures, platforms and application infrastructure required to successfully implement a complete solution using best practices on Google Cloud.
  • Travel to customer sites, conferences, and other related events.

Location

item.title: Customer Solutions Developer, Google Technical Professional Services
item.description:
2022-05-13T14:31:44.944Z

Customer Solutions Developer, Google Technical Professional Services

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Toronto, ON, Canada
Apply

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor\'s degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience
  • 2 years of experience working with web technologies (e.g., HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and/or HTTP)
  • Experience coding with a programming language (e.g., Java, C/C++, Python)

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience working with and managing internal and external partners/customers
  • Experience with the ad serving industry and internet technologies, data integration projects, and cloud technologies
  • Ability to adapt a message to the technical level of an audience and present technical materials to groups of any size
  • Excellent problem solving, analytical, and troubleshooting skills
  • Excellent attention to detail and project management skills

About the job

gTech’s Professional Services team takes a creative, collaborative, and customer-centric approach to provide foundational services and forward-looking business solutions to top advertiser and publisher customers. Through technical implementation, optimization, and key solutions, gTech Professional Services helps customers attain their business goals while building long-term capabilities.

In this role, you will develop innovative solutions to the business problems faced by advertisers. You will work as a critical technical partner for our Sales teams. You will develop solutions that will take many forms, from prototypes and demos to education all with the technology resources of Google to back it up. Seeing the unique business challenges faced by our advertisers, you will be identifying and prioritizing projects and will be developing solutions. Working across the entire organization, you will leverage your wide-ranging experience and skill-set to find the best solution for the problems.

Google creates products and services that make the world a better place, and gTech’s role is to help bring them to life. Our teams of trusted advisors support customers globally. Our solutions are rooted in our technical skill, product expertise, and a thorough understanding of our customers’ complex needs. Whether the answer is a bespoke solution to solve a unique problem, or a new tool that can scale across Google, everything we do aims to ensure our customers benefit from the full potential of Google products.

To learn more about gTech, check out our video.

Responsibilities

  • Work closely with customers to understand underlying business challenges.
  • Build relationships with the Sales team and customers, then leverage these relationships to identify and develop innovative technical solutions that lead to more advertising business.
  • Design, create, and present prototypes, demos, and proofs-of-concept to a wide variety of audiences, from Developers to Marketing. Leverage Google’s Cloud infrastructure and big data analytics systems to achieve goals.
  • Provide technical consulting services and guidance around Google APIs and Google Cloud platforms to help clients develop applications across products.

Location

item.title: Developer Relations Specialist, Reliable Software Delivery and Operations
item.description:
2022-04-29T15:32:01.033Z

Developer Relations Specialist, Reliable Software Delivery and Operations

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Toronto, ON, Canada
  • + 1 more location
Apply

Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Toronto, ON, Canada; Kitchener, ON, Canada.

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor\'s degree in Computer Science, Developing, or a related field, or equivalent practical experience
  • 3 years of experience developing, delivering, and/or operating business software

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience speaking at technology conferences, blogging/writing technical articles, or contributing to open source projects
  • Experience interfacing with customers including technical practitioners, managers, department heads, and executives
  • Experience helping develop and grow collaborative and inclusive teams
  • Experience with infrastructure such as code, software delivery pipelines, and monitoring production environments
  • Ability to work globally and collaboratively in a team environment and to influence technical practitioners, stakeholders, and globally distributed teams

About the job

The Customer Advocacy team is made up of technical practitioners with experience building, deploying, and operating applications in Google Cloud. We inspire, educate, and enable customers to transform the way they achieve their technology-enabled business goals. We improve teams\' capabilities, allowing them to experience the benefits of using Google Cloud.

The Cloud Developer Relations team consists of members from a wide range of technology roles including Software Developers, Data Scientists and Developers, Machine Learning Scientists, System Administrators, Site Reliability Developer, and Cloud Developers who combine their domain expertise with a desire to help Google Cloud build products and solutions that are important to their own communities and that solve their problems in simple, scalable, and innovative ways.

As a Cloud Developer Relations Specialist, you will build narratives and experiences that connect Google Cloud products and services to the principles, practices, and capabilities that drive reliable software delivery and operations performance. You will guide and amplify practitioner-led organizational transformation with teams working for Google Cloud customers.

Responsibilities

  • Participate in Developer Operations, Site Reliability Developing, security, and/or programming language communities as a direct practitioner.
  • Work with research, product, and developing teams on product strategies and narratives around new products and features.
  • Provide technical contributions in the form of open source software, product enhancements, and product design. Coach teams on improving their reliable software delivery and operations performance.
  • Create original content to inspire usage of Google Cloud leading to more reliable software delivery and operations performance.
  • Advocate for practitioners internally and influence Google Cloud product strategy by working with Product Management, Developing, Public Relations, Marketing, Business Development, and other cross-functional teams.

Locations

item.title: Student Researcher, BS, 2022
item.description:
2022-04-12T14:31:44.976Z

Student Researcher, BS, 2022

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Toronto, ON, Canada
  • + 1 more location
Apply

Participation in this program requires that you are located in Canada for the duration of the engagement.

NOTE: This opportunity is intended for students who are pursuing a BS degree with an anticipated graduation date after December 2023, depending on their program and unique circumstances. If you are graduating before December 2023, we encourage you to apply to the Research Internship opening.

To start the application process, you will need an updated CV or resume and a current unofficial or official transcript in English (PDFs preferred). Please ensure your anticipated graduation dates (in MM/YY) and any proficiency in coding languages are listed on resume


Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Toronto, ON, Canada; Waterloo, ON, Canada.

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Currently enrolled in a Bachelor\'s degree in Computer Science, Linguistics, Statistics, Biostatistics, Applied Mathematics, Operations Research, Economics, Natural Sciences, or a related technical field.
  • Experience in one area of computer science (e.g., Natural Language Understanding, Computer Vision, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Algorithmic Foundations of Optimization, Quantum Information Science, Data Science, Software Engineering, or similar).

Preferred qualifications:

  • Currently enrolled in a full-time degree program and returning to the program after completion of the internship.
  • Currently attending a degree program in Canada.
  • Experience as a researcher, including internships, full-time, or at a lab.
  • Experience contributing to research communities or efforts, including publishing papers in major conferences or journals.
  • Experience with one or more general purpose programming languages, including: C/C++, Java, MATLAB, Go, Python, or similar.
  • Ability to speak and write in English fluently.

About the job

The Student Researcher Program’s primary objective is to foster academic collaborations with students through research at Google. Join us for a paid Student Researcher position that offers the opportunity to work directly with Google research scientists and engineers on cutting-edge research projects.

The Student Researcher Program offers more opportunities for research students to work on critical research projects at Google in a less structured way. The program allows for flexibility beyond the limitations of our traditional internship program on aspects such as duration, time commitment, and working location (with options for on-site or remote). The topics student researchers work on tend to be open-ended and exploratory, and don\'t always have a clear deliverable like a traditional internship would.

Google Research is building the next generation of intelligent systems for all Google products. To achieve this, we’re working on projects that utilize the latest computer science techniques developed by skilled software engineers and research scientists. Google Research teams collaborate closely with other teams across Google, maintaining the flexibility and versatility required to adapt new projects and foci that meet the demands of the world\'s fast-paced business needs.

Responsibilities

  • Participate in research to develop solutions for real-world, large-scale problems.

Locations

To navigate, press the arrow keys.

Map data ©2022 Google

item.title: Technical Writer, Internal Developer Relations
item.description:
2022-03-28T22:31:40.217Z

Technical Writer, Internal Developer Relations

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Toronto, ON, Canada
Apply

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor\'s degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 4 years of experience creating content for a technical audience (e.g., developer documentation, Computer Science course materials, and/or IT administrative playbooks).
  • Experience with technologies (e.g., software or hardware systems) by investigation, direct experimentation (e.g., reading or running code), and/or interactions with Subject Matter Experts.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience writing for an Android developer audience or writing code for Android.
  • Experience writing content for an audience of software developers.
  • Experience researching and writing effective documentation for developers.
  • Understanding of data pipeline concepts.
  • Proficiency in a UNIX environment.

About the job

We are engaged, innovative, growth-oriented technical writers who want to change the world with great documentation for Google engineers.

This is a technical writing individual contributor role in the Analytics, Logging, and Experiments space in Core Developer. You will be working on end-to-end performance analytics solution for first-party Android apps. With this role, you\'ll have the opportunity for cross-functional interactions with Software Developers, Product Managers, Technical Program Managers, Program Managers, and members of developer relations staff like instructional designers and more.

Responsibilities

  • Work closely with project teams to understand documentation requirements.
  • Design information architecture for complex documentation sets.
  • Facilitate, edit, and curate documentation produced by product managers and developers.
  • Develop documentation content in partnership with technical staff.
  • Advocate for users, and influence product design and implementation.

item.title: Manager, Application Architecture – Intact Lab
item.description:
Who needs insurance? Everybody. That keeps us busy. Very busy.

At the Intact Lab, we use machine learning, data science, software engineering, AI, agility, UX and design thinking to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians. 

Simplifying insurance takes creativity, empathy and hard work. We explore, take risks, make mistakes, and learn all day, every day

Here, innovation is everyone\'s job. Ready to make your mark? 
About the role

Your mandate:

  • Align application architecture practices with new technologies, providing migration solutions to public and internal clouds.
  • Deploy your knowledge to coach the architects in your team so that they can develop portable architectures to different clouds.
  • Influence your partners so that the proposed architectures are implemented according to the best practices of cloud native developments
  • Influence the different roadmaps to realistically integrate changes to existing systems to our target architecture


You will :

  • Develop your team to be engaged and productive while promoting the development of personal and technical skills, as well as collaboration
  • Develop the application architecture and related best practices for all digital lab applications (mobile, web and backend)
  • Collaborate with other managers to ensure that all initiatives have the right people, balancing the needs of the business with each person\'s background and career aspirations.
  • Collaborate with the enterprise and solution architecture to ensure that application architecture decisions are aligned with the directions and vision of the business
  • Ensure our impressive work meets company standards for software engineering, architecture and quality
  • Continuously evolve development practices, tools and processes in order to increase the autonomy and efficiency of teams in collaboration with the software engineering managers of the Lab
  • See to the smooth running of the application architecture delivery and make the necessary corrections when required
  • Collaborate with the different product teams to ensure that the application architecture meets the needs of digital products
  • Master all facets of software development, understand how all the components interact and can impact the performance and quality of the products delivered
  • Communicate the technological vision to team members and ensure its governance
  • Master Agile / Scrum development and ensure that the processes and tools are well suited to it
  • Cultivate change and initiate innovation
  • Stay abreast of new technologies and question the status quo.
Qualifications

You are:

  • Bilingual
  • Passionate about creating software products.
  • Passionate about software architecture and technological innovations
  • Stimulated by challenges.
  • Creative, curious and resourceful.
  • An agent of change and challenge the status quo
  • Excellent communicator able to explain their ideas to various stakeholders.
  • Visionary with a good understanding of the IT world challenges
  • Diplomat, organized, proactive and a team player.
  • A servant leader who knows how to create an open and participatory environment
  • Comfortable working in a constantly changing technological environment.


You bring with you:

  • Bachelor\'s degree in Information Technology / Software Engineering or any combination of training and equivalent experience.
  • More than 10 years of experience in the design and development of software applications.
  • Solid management experience including at least 2 years in management and coordination of senior technical people and application architects.
  • A solid experience in the delivery of products in Agile / Scrum mode in Software Engineering.
  • Strong understanding of Java, Mobile, etc., web application technologies.
  • Strong understanding of different types of software architecture (Web, service oriented, distributed, event oriented, CQRS, cloud native etc.)
  • Good knowledge of different front-end technologies (React, vue, angularJS, etc.)
  • Good knowledge of different backend frameworks (kotlyn, nodeJS, Java an asset).
  • Experience with best practices in application security.
     

Here are a few reasons why others have joined our team: 

  • An award-winning, inspiring workplace that supports its people and recognizes great work 
  • Stimulating, challenging projects and development opportunities to help you grow your skills and career
  • A comprehensive financial rewards program that recognizes your success
  • An extensive, flexible benefits package
  • An industry leading Employee Share Purchase Plan where we match 50% of net shares purchased
  • A $350 annual wellness account that promotes an active lifestyle

Flexible Work Arrangements

We’re proud to support a flexible hybrid approach which gives everyone the best of both worlds. While there are no minimum or maximum time requirements, each team’s need for in-person connections will be different and there will be times you’ll join your colleagues at the office. 

#hybrid
Closing Statement

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer

If we can provide a specific adjustment to make the recruitment process more accessible for you, please let us know when we reach out about a job opportunity. We’ll work with you to meet your needs.

Click here to review other important information about the hiring process, including background checks, internal candidates, and eligibility to work in Canada.

item.title: Data Scientists & AI Developers Interns – Hong Kong, Intact Lab (Fall 2022 / Winter 2023)
item.description:
Calling all students interested in AI and machine learning! We have several fantastic opportunities for AI Developer Interns and Data Scientist Interns to join our team. We are looking for interns who can commit to a minimum of 3 months during : 

  • Fall 2022 (September to December)
  • Winter 2023 (January to May)

Artificial intelligence is shaping the future of insurance. Our latest lab, located in the Hong Kong Science and Technology Park is turning this vision into a reality. As Canada\'s largest home, auto and business insurer, we\'re here to cultivate the next generation of technology and talent. Together, we\'re helping our customers protect what matters to them most through the power of data science, machine learning and AI. 
 
About the role

As a tech pioneer within a new AI lab, you’ll have the opportunity to:

  • Use machine learning and advanced statistics to help build innovative solutions for real-life customer and business problems
  • Explore new technologies to use in your own solutions
  • Grow alongside a diverse team of world-class experts in data science, software engineering, actuarial science, business and design
  • Transform data into meaningful conclusions and recommendations
  • Validate the scientific methodology and project outputs of the other team members
  • Collaborate with our teams in HK & Canada to share knowledge, learnings, results, and tools 
  • All this plus great work-life balance!
     
Qualifications

Data Scientist Intern - Here’s what you bring to the table:

  • Currently enrolled in a post-secondary degree in a quantitative discipline such as computer science, AI mathematics, engineering, statistics, science,  or a related field. 
  • Relevant experience in predictive modelling, machine learning and advanced statistics solving business problems is an asset
  • Knowledge of the underlying theory and implementation details of machine learning techniques such as clustering, decision trees, neural networks, Linear and Non-Linear Programming, Deep Learning (ANN, RNN, CNN) and Reinforcement Learning
  • Experience with our tech stack is an asset: scikit-learn, xgboost, pytorch, tensorflow, LightGBM, pandas, numpy
  • Programming experience in languages such as Python or R 
  • Unlimited curiosity and a passion to challenge the status quo
  • Ability to focus on vaguely defined issues requiring the application of a creative approach
  • Excellent communication, organization and a collaborative attitude

AI Developer Intern - Here’s what you bring to the table:

  • Currently enrolled in a post-seconddary degree in computer science, software engineering, AI or a related discipline
  • Experience with Python or other language such as Java, C++, C#, etc 
  • Knowledge of our tech stack: Flask, MongoDB, Kafka, ElasticSearch 
  • Unlimited curiosity and a passion to challenge the status quo
  • Ability to focus on vaguely defined issues requiring the application of a creative approach
  • Strong communication, time management and work organization skills
  • If you don’t have experience in AI, a strong desire to immerse yourself in this exciting field
Closing Statement

Life in the Lab

Technology is only as good as the people behind it. Every day at work, you’ll inspire and be inspired by the brilliant minds of our greater lab team: actuaries, data scientists, machine learning experts, geomathematicians, meteorologists, software engineers and designers.

As our company grows, your career will grow with it.  There will always be an opportunity for you to develop your leadership skills, strengthen your expertise or take your work in a new direction.  Whether it’s moving into a new, exciting project or taking a leadership role in either managerial or technical path, your career will always be on the move.

About Us

The Intact Lab – with headquarters in Montreal, Canada – is a fast-growing, digital innovation hub backed by Intact Financial Corporation (TSX: IFC, HK$110 billion in market cap), Canada’s largest home, auto and business insurance company. 

Intact Financial (HK) limited (Intact Lab, HK) is our first R&D A.I. centre outside of Canada. This expansion into the Asia Pacific region is an exciting chapter of our journey to become the best insurance A.I. shop in the world.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer

At Intact, our value of Respect is founded on seeing diversity as a strength, being inclusive and fostering collaboration. We value diversity and strive to create an inclusive, accessible workplace where all individuals feel valued, respected and heard. 

If we can provide a specific adjustment to make the recruitment process more accessible for you, please advise the Talent Acquisition partner who reaches out about the job opportunity and they will work with you to meet your needs. 

Background Checks

As an employer and publicly traded financial services company, the best interests of our customers, employees and shareholders are important to us.  We want Intact to be a great place to work!  This means that internal and external candidates will be asked to consent to background checks so we can learn more about you. Please note that for positions with access to financial data or funds, your credit must be in good standing.

#LI-IT

item.description:
Who needs insurance? Everybody. That keeps us busy. Very busy.

At the Intact Lab, we use machine learning, data science, software engineering, AI, agility, UX and design thinking to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians.

About the role

Are you passionate about e-commerce and digital innovation? Are you skilled at translating complex requirements into usable and delightful experiences? Do you keep on top of the latest trends in design and love experimenting with new tools and methodologies? We\'ve got the perfect opportunity for you!

What you’ll do here:

  • Create highly useable, visually stunning, and fun-to-use UI designs for digital applications.
  • Develop clear, functional UI mockups & prototypes.
  • Visualize, propose, and present creative design concepts in a variety of visual styles.
  • Conduct user tests and interviews to validate designs.
  • Interpret a brand book for multiple brands.
  • Contribute to the creation and maintenance of a front-end component library (Design system).
  • Generate UI assets and work with developers to implement to required specifications.
  • Be an advocate for user-centred, data-driven design.

What you bring to the table:

  • At least two years of UI experience.
  • UX experience would be considered an asset.
  • Expertise in usability and user-centred design practices.
  • Mastery of design tools (Sketch, Axure, InVision, Illustrator, etc.).
  • Experience with UX research tools an asset (usertesting.com, Optimal Workshop, etc.).
  • You love working in a collaborative environment that has a strong focus on teamwork, innovation, open minds and having fun.

 

Please include your portfolio in your application.

You are:

  • Creative, analytical, curious and ingenious.

item.description:
Who needs insurance? Everybody. That keeps us busy. Very busy.

At the Intact Lab, we use machine learning, data science, software engineering, AI, agility, UX and design thinking to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians. 

Simplifying insurance takes creativity, empathy and hard work. We explore, take risks, make mistakes, and learn all day, every day.

Here, innovation is everyone\'s job. Ready to make your mark? 
About the role

Are you a machine learning expert who believes we are only in the infancy of artificial intelligence? Are you passionate about advanced analytics and Big Data? Do you stay current with the latest trends in analytics and jump at the chance to experiment with new tools? We have the perfect opportunity for you!

Hiring Manager: Amine Mahmoudi

Workplace: Toronto (700, University Ave)

Your contribution:

  • Be the technical leader that help defining data science problems and developing innovative solutions using machine learning and advanced statistics
  • Help achieve long-term business goals by identifying and implementing solutions to subtle or ambiguous problems with the highest scientific rigour
  • Influence the lab technical direction by making actionable recommendations based on scientific and business findings to management
  • Coaching and mentoring of senior data scientists on technical matters and act as a technical reference for management
  • Review machine learning solutions and identify their corresponding scientific debt, and ultimately assess readiness for production deployment
  • Help the teams maintain a high scientific level by monitoring the application of data science standards of practice and participate in their evolution
  • Keep pace with new approaches and trends and use them in your own solutions
  • Work with other departments to promote the adoption of analytical principles within the organization

  • Your Master’s or PhD’s degree in a relevant discipline (mathematics, science, engineering, operational research, economics, statistics, AI, computer science or a related field)
  • Your 8 years of experience in the field of advanced statistics, data mining and text mining
  • Strong communication, time management, great teamworking and organization skills
  • Expert-level understanding of the underlying theory of machine learning
  • Expert-level understanding in either computer image analysis, natural language processing or artificial intelligence
  • A multi-platform production experience with commercial and open-source data mining frameworks like Python, R, GitHub, etc.

item.title: Senior DevOps, Intact Lab
item.description:
#ItsAboutPeople

Who needs insurance? Everybody. That keeps us busy. Very busy.

At the Intact Lab, we use machine learning, data science, software engineering, AI, agility, UX and design thinking to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians.

Simplifying insurance takes creativity, empathy and hard work. We explore, take risks, make mistakes, and learn all day, every day

Here, innovation is everyone\'s job. Ready to make your mark? A career in insurance has never been this exciting.
About the role

Your role:

With little to no guidance, proposing guidelines and carries out the different activities related to the execution of platform development activities by developing automation to enable software development and deployment by implementing CI/CD pipelines, infrastructure as code, configuration as code, etc.  

Assists devops lead in developing POC\'s to validate ideas.  May assist in leading implementation plans.  

Assist devops team members by providing guidance and code reviews to support development of devops skills in the team. Will guide and support to a level 1 and 2 role.
 

What you will be doing:

  • Coding: Investigates and fixes complex defects (for multiple smaller functional applications); develops and designs technical solutions for existing products or for enhancements to new/future releases.
  • Debugging/Troubleshooting: Performs root cause analysis, interprets the results, and develops action plan and priorities for backlogs (identifying short- and long-term solutions); may lead implementation of plan
  • Requirement Development: Leads development of requirements, understanding impact of architecture on overall solution.
  • Design: Leads proof-of-concept for medium to large initiatives; implements prototypes to validate ideas. Designs for conformity between deployment environments, scalability, security and flexibility.
  • Monitoring/Support: Independently handles and provides additional support in solving software/system monitoring issues and escalations which require complex technical expertise to troubleshoot.  Provides input for configuration activities such as alerts, dashboards, etc.
  • Reviews critical tickets/incidents for lower levels to ensure accuracy; provides input into monitoring systems and leads resolution process for critical issues that impact multiple applications or groups.
  • Assist development teams by providing guidance of observability best practices and implementations.
  • Assist in tracking and reporting of costs.
  • Deployment: Researches and proposes solutions for automation of deployments.
Qualifications

Your skills:

  • Bachelor\'s degree in a related field
  • 5 to 8 years of experience
  • Expertise in AWS and cloud technologies
  • Experience in CICD process and tools such as Git, GitHub, Terraform, Jenkins
  • Experience in Snowflake and Databricks in a great asset.
  • Certifications in AWS, Jenkins, Terraform
  • Knowledge of ITSM and SDLC methodologies (Agile, Waterfall, ITIL, SDLC, SCRUM, Kanban).
  • A self-starter, who can drive and follow through the initiatives from the beginning to the end.
  • Bilingual is a strong asset.
